story_txt:
zur deutschen Version scrollen




At a glance - Seeing like a young person again


The eye. It is our most important sensory organ.


Wouldn't it be great to see perfectly sharply from near to far like a young person again without the
annoying
glasses.
By the age of 50, everyone is suffering from presbyopia. Opacification of the lens – cataracts – are even
worse: one in two people over 60 gets them, and a further one in two of these are operated on. There are
still no satisfactory solutions to restore natural, healthy eyesight.
This is exactly what we are working on: the new bio-inspired intraocular lens „DeepSight“ by biolnic should soon enable sharp near vision and far vision. DeepSight imitates the
incredible softness and elasticity of a healthy, natural lens and also deforms just like one. It's like inventing the fountain of youth for your eyes.
We have a highly promising solution for the problems of presbyopia and cataracts – DeepSight must be
developed to a marketable stage and a first clinical trial on humans must be carried out. This will take about 2,5 years. For this we need
you!
Make something unique possible: purchase a transferable option on a pair of DeepSight
lenses now with a 20%, 40% or 90% discount on the intended market price of $5,000 (4,000€), which you can redeem after achieving
marketability. Or we will pass every of your donations to charitable foundations who help prevent blindness, and in addition, we will donate a pair of DeepSight every time biolnic raises $500 via your donations, if the project will succeed.
We get 80% of our impressions from healthy eyes. We are working meticulously on
significantly improving our quality of life in old age with DeepSight
so that we can live more actively.
Please support us in doing so, here or soon on biolnic.com.


Content

A little bit of medicine first of all
How DeepSight works
What will make DeepSight unique
Who is behind DeepSight
The work we do

Our awesome partners


Challenges to be mastered


Let’s go, we need you! (Perks)


News


Synopsis


FAQ


Top



A little bit of medicine first of all

The natural lens 


The lens of the human eye is a crystal-clear, extremely elastic body which bundles the light
that enters
via the pupil onto the retina to create a sharp picture. It is embedded in a wafer-thin
“capsular sac”
which is attached to the ring-formed ciliary muscle by zonula fibers, which radiate
laterally into the
equator of the capsule.



Cataracts and presbyopia
A particularly serious and slowly progressive disease is cataracts, in which the lenses of
the eye become
opaque, resulting in increased glare sensitivity of the eye and faded perception of colors.
Advanced
cataracts can only be treated through surgery to replace the natural lens with an artificial
intraocular
lens (IOL) after opening of the capsular sac.

Presbyopia is the age-related loss of the adaptability of the eye to different object
distances
(accommodation). This is essentially based on the loss of elasticity in the lens core. This is
normally
corrected using one or more pairs of glasses.



Accommodation


In accommodation - the focusing of the eye - the ring-shaped muscle (“ciliar”) does not exert
any force
on the lens as you would assume. Instead, the zonula fibers relax in the event of
contraction of the
ciliary muscle and the lens switches into its natural spherical shape for near vision. Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI)
examinations
show that the changes in diameter during accommodation of the ciliary muscle are only
slightly different
for young people and old people, at approximately
0.6 mm.




Conventional IOLs


Standard intraocular lenses (IOLs) have only one focus and provide either near or far vision.

There are also bifocal or multifocal lenses with more than one focus which are not completely
rigid like
the standard IOLs but, however, are unable to accommodate and to change their shape. The
disadvantage of
multifocal lenses is the significantly worse contrast vision and increased glare sensitivity
(particularly at night). In a similar manner to varifocal glasses, the field of vision is
narrower which
results in a non-physiological rocking of the head.




Complications of IOLs
The most frequent complication arising from the use of intraocular lenses is the opacification of
the
posterior capsule (post-cataract occurrences). This requires additional laser surgery.



Accommodable IOLs

Contrary to what is widely assumed, the accommodation of the eye is not yet able to be
returned to a
satisfactory state. Only refractive power changes of about 1.5 diopter can be achieved, but
at least
3 diopter are needed for near and far vision.

There is a lack of sophisticated biomechanical solutions in which the function of focusing
imitates the
nature function as closely as possible. And this needs to be without the eye or brain having
to shift,
without (optical) mistakes and without electronic aids!

Another shortcoming: the capsular sac “damaged” by opening can compress a flexible IOL
into its
flat condition for far vision only to a very limited extent.




Setting new standards

The power transmission that is behind construction and design of the DeepSight is much more efficient. In this,
the IOL is to be
connected to the ciliary muscle directly.


Content


How “DeepSight” works
Looking into nature’s soul





How it should work



The lens-shaped DeepSight is flat in its distance condition,
just
like its natural model. It consists of a thin, extremely elastic shell and a liquid, highly
refractive
core. The ciliary muscle nestles itself around the “haptic ring”, the edge of the IOL. This
one can
follow the contraction of the ciliary muscle due to the thin slits. The DeepSight get rounder: near objects become sharp!








Our simulations (optical as well as stress and deformation analyses) show that with the
bio-inspired
DeepSight a multiple of refractive power change than the
necessary 3 diopter for near to distant vision can be achieved already with less than a
half
diameter change of the ciliar. This has still to be proven in the clinical trial.





How DeepSight should
be implanted



The DeepSight should be implanted in a similarly
uncomplicated
way like conventional IOLs, which can be performed in as little as 10 minutes. For implantation, the capsular sac is removed or shifted
behind the
intraocular lens. The DeepSight is inserted into the
ciliary muscle. In addition
it can be fixed to the ciliary muscle or eyeball. During implantation, the lens is
pressed flat so
the filling is transferred to a connected tube which is rolled up into a small shape.




Content


What will make DeepSight unique
DeepSight stands out in all of its details by the simplicity of the
design
in the form of a bio-inspired system which is very close to human physiology. The change in shape of the IOL as an indicator for the accommodation capacity is even much higher than that of the natural lens ie from an almost flat far vision state to a highly curved near vision state.

These unique selling propositions are our objective

Natural, sharp vision from approximately 25 cm to a distance without further visual aids,
restriction
of the visual field and an adjustment of the eye or brain.


DeepSight aims to make the most possible use of the muscle
contraction by being fully enclosed by the ciliary muscle and by being extremely deformable
due to the
slits in the haptic ring and liquid core.

The very large optics provides significantly improved night vision.
The post-cataract occurrences or a decentration are far less likely.
It also aims to help patients suffering from very poor vision.
Lower costs in the long term compared to other visual aids.
Patients with conventional IOLs can replace them with DeepSight.



Content


Who is behind DeepSight
We’re a team of biomedical and scientific experts who get their kicks from using tech to make people
fall in
love with our lenses




We, Andreas, Ben and Josef know each other from the COTECH Project supported by the European Union
(www.fp7-cotech.eu).


Dr. Josef Jansen is the founder of biolnic and head of DeepSight.
As a mechanical engineer (having written his dissertation/PhD on artificial heart valves), for
the last 30
years he has been working on the development of implants for the human body which imitate
nature. His core
skill is the analysis and understanding of the mechanism of action of body parts which are put
under a
large amount of stress and their technical and constructive implementation in a physiological
biomechanical
design with elasticity close to that found in nature. Josef combines the highest technical
requirements with
the simplicity of natural solutions. Visionary and innovative product development is his
passion. And this
frequently comes from small, innovative companies which often achieve more skill, flexibility
and continuity
in this special field.



Dr. Andreas Schoth is physicist and engineer and a scientific expert in the field of
microsystem
technology. He has been working in this innovative field since he wrote his dissertation (PhD)
on quantum
mechanical silicon sensors in 1995. Freely adapted from Richard Feynman’s "There is Plenty of
Room at the
Bottom", Andreas researches and develops manufacturing technologies for different applications;
from “lab on
the chip” to highly miniaturized implants. This also includes, for example, micro and nano
injection molding
of smart materials.



Dr. Ben Whiteside has been pushing the boundaries of ultra-high precision injection
molding since
2001. His background includes a PhD study of the mechanical properties of polymer composite
materials and
over ten years as a researcher and lecturer studying computer modelling of polymer processes,
process data
acquisition of polymer manufacturing systems, high speed imaging and visualization technique
development and
manufacturing of polymer components with micro and nano-scale precision. Ben is now Director of
the Centre
for Micro and Nano Molding at the University of Bradford, which is a unique facility worldwide
for the
manufacture of nano-precision devices using a wide range of materials.

Content


The work we do



We go to painstaking lengths to ensure that no stone is left unturned in our quest for the best way
forward to
an accommodative IOL

Where we stand


The design of the IOL was developed for attachment to the ciliary muscle. We have therefore
already been
through a long process in which numerous designs of the DeepSight
were simulated using complex calculation programs. In addition, it was also possible to
manufacture a
prototype of an extremely complex shaped IOL intended for implantation in the capsular sac
using
state-of-the-art micro technologies – with a partner from Bradford in the European COTECH
Project (www.fp7-cotech.eu).




What has to be done



A great deal of work is still in front of us. The micro precision manufacturing technology
and the
design of DeepSight are further optimized in terms of the
plastics
used and tailored to one another. Various different examinations and tests are being carried
out.
Initial pre-production models of the DeepSight are being
examined
in a clinical pilot investigation with 10 patients in which accommodation ability of the IOL
is being
demonstrated over a period of six months (until mid-2017). Therefore biolnic needs
approximately $2.1 (1.7€) million. And that’s why we need you!

The subsequent, extensive clinical trial with approximately 400 patients should last for
around two
years. In parallel, automated series production will be established. This can be covered by
EU financing
programs. Marketability of the DeepSight lens as medical
product
for the European region should then be achieved and the sale by industry partners can begin.




Series production – quality knows no compromises

The series production of DeepSight is likely to be carried out by
biolnic itself and built up together with the partners. 

This is because the highest possible quality standards are always at the forefront!


Content


Our awesome partners
Close cooperation with excellent partners enables us to do world-class work
For the micro production technologies, biolnic is cooperating with competent partners from the COTECH
EU
project.

The COTECH project


biolnic is continuing the developments in accommodable intraocular lenses made by the company be
innovative
on the basis of the COTECH (2008-2012: „Converging technologies for micro systems
manufacturing“, www.fp7-cotech.eu) project supported by the
European Union. Completely new
micro production technologies were developed by 25 European partners in COTECH. The
“demonstrator” created
by be innovative was an accommodable IOL which can be implanted in the capsular sac with
deformable optics.
The IOL was made of two differently shaped, aspherical half shells which were then assembled.








The Centre for Polymer Micro and Nano Technology at the University of Bradford (UK) has
been
internationally recognized for its pioneering research in the field of micro injection molding
since 2001.
It has an extensive range of cutting edge processing hardware specifically designed for the
industrial-scale
manufacture of micro and nano precision components. They have developed bespoke systems for
monitoring the
behavior of the raw material and the equipment dynamics in production processes. Further novel
sensor
technologies and data acquisition systems enable full traceability of the production environment
for product
manufacture – particularly relevant for the medical device sector. In addition, the Centre has a
dedicated
characterization laboratory (e.g. for assessing the shape and mechanical properties of micro
injection
molded components and surface features). A highly skilled team provides the expertise for
developing new
processes and technologies to overcome the significant challenges required for the manufacture
of
state-of-the-art devices.








The Department of Microsystems Engineering (IMTEK) at the University of Freiburg
(Germany) is an
internationally leading institute in the field of life sciences, brain computers interface and
micro/nanotechnology. IMTEK has detailed knowledge and experience in the field of plastic
molding with sub
micrometer precision and in the production of high-precision injection molded shapes and
embossing dies with
optical surfaces.








The Department of Experimental Ophthalmology (Prof. Dr. rer. nat. Dr. med. Solon Thanos)
is a
recognized research institution at the University of Münster (Germany). The working group
dominates the
field of clinical and experimental ophthalmology, biocompatibility studies, in vitro cultures of
nerve, lens
and corneal cells are routinely carried out.

Content


Challenges to be mastered
Great ideas need robust strategies to turn them into reality

Needless to say, many medical technology risks and challenges arise during the development of new
implants
for the human body: 

The micro injection molding of highly elastic precision components and thus production of DeepSight are extremely demanding but can be realized with
our
competent partners from the COTECH project.

The accommodation of DeepSight must be adequately shown
within
the scope of the clinical trials on humans.

Furthermore, the precise selection of the correct size of IOL for the ciliary muscle depends
on the
care of the physician and suitable imaging procedures. Ophthalmologists, however, are used
to precision
and care.

Generally, the long-term behavior of implants cannot be assessed 100% reliably in advance.
But it
should be the same as for the conventional IOL.


It certainly should also be pointed out here that it is possible that in such projects
development steps,
tests or even clinical trials may need to be repeated. This can result in the failure of the
enterprise in
the worst case due to not reaching marketability of the lenses as a medical product and
therefore a loss of
the option. We are certainly going to do our best to ensure that this does not happen, but we
are not able
to rule out such a worst case scenario entirely.

Content


Let’s go, we need you! (Perks)
Let’s do something awesome together


With your support, the DeepSight project
could lead to a breakthrough in the treatment of presbyopia and cataracts. A return
to natural, youthful vision both near and far can bring you a significantly
improved quality of life: full enjoyment of visual stimuli, a more active
lifestyle and mental performance that continues into old age.
As soon as DeepSight lenses are authorized
for market sales, you can follow up on the options below via your
ophthalmologist (eye clinic) at a time convenient to you. The option is also
transferable to another individual, for example a grandmother or partner … -
whatever the reason!
We are very excited about this
project and hope you are too. We appreciate your support and please share
DeepSight with your friends too.
Perks


Donations: we are most grateful for your support! We will pass your $25 donation (or any other amount) to charitable foundations such as Vision 2020, Médecins sans Frontières, Christian Blind Mission, BigShoe etc. who help people threatened by blindness especially due to congenital or infantile cataracts or other eye diseases, if the project will succeed. In addition, we donate a pair of DeepSight ($5,000 projected market value) every time biolnic raises $500 via your donations.Thank you! Your name will
appear on our website (unless you prefer to remain anonymous) in a list of our
valued supporters.
For a $500 option (~400€), you receive one pair of IOLs (at a 90%
discount on the future retail price of $5,000/~4,000€ per pair) and save $4,500
(~3,600€) on subsequent utilization. 
For a $125 option (~100€), you receive a 20% discount on one pair
IOLs on subsequent utilization and purchases. At a future retail price of
$5,000 (~4,000€) per pair, you pay only $3,875 (~3,100€) [$5,000 - 20% - option
price] for 2 IOLs and thus save $1,000 (~800€). 
For a $310 option (~250€), you receive a 40% discount on one pair
IOLs on subsequent utilization and purchases. At a future retail price of
$5,000 (~4,000€) per pair, you pay only $2,690 (~2,150€) [$5,000 - 40% - option
price] for 2 IOLs and thus save $2,000 (~1,600€). 

With the options above, you have the choice
of any design of an accommodable intraocular lens from biolnic. For example,
this could include the DeepSight with UV filter protection or a design that
compensates specific visual defects such as warping of the cornea
(astigmatism).
As the campaign describes, DeepSight is a
development project aimed at achieving marketability of the DeepSight product.
Success is not guaranteed. Unfortunately, in the event that we do not succeed
despite all joint efforts, the above options are not valid. Purchasers outside
the European Union are responsible for paying VAT (see FAQ).


Content


News

See us on Future ideas.

Our press release on PRWeb.

We are most grateful for the outstanding support of InmediasP (Berlin, GER) in the preparation of the website of biolnic and this campaign site as well as the animations of the pitch.

Content




Content


FAQ

Content
Top








Auf einen Blick - Wieder sehen können wie ein junger Mensch


Das Auge. Es ist unser wichtigstes Sinnesorgan. 
Was wäre es doch toll, wieder wie ein junger Mensch von nah bis fern perfekt
scharf sehen zu können –
ohne lästige Brillen.
Unter Alterssichtigkeit leidet spätestens jeder über 50. Viel schlimmer ist die
Linseneintrübung,
der Graue Star: Jeder 2. über 60 bekommt ihn, davon wird jeder 2. operiert. Bisher gibt es hierzu
keine zufriedenstellenden Lösungen, die natürliche, gesunde Sehfähigkeit zurückzuerlangen!
Genau daran arbeiten wir: Mit der neuen bioinspirierten Intraokularlinse „DeepSight“ von biolnic soll schon
bald scharfes Sehen
von nah bis fern ermöglicht werden! DeepSight imitiert die ungeheure
Weichheit und Elastizität der
gesunden, natürlichen Linse und verformt sich auch so wie diese.
Wir haben eine äußerst vielversprechende Lösung für die Probleme der
Alterssichtigkeit und des
Grauen Star in der Hand – DeepSight muss zur Marktreife entwickelt und
am Menschen erstmals klinisch erprobt
werden. Dies dauert etwa 2,5 Jahre. Hierfür brauchen wir Sie!
Ermöglichen Sie etwas Einzigartiges: Erwerben Sie jetzt eine übertragbare Option
auf ein Paar
DeepSight mit 20%, 40% oder 90% Rabatt auf den anvisierten Marktpreis von $5.000 (4.000€),
die
Sie im Fall der Erlangung der
Marktfähigkeit einlösen können. Oder wir werden jede Ihrer Spenden im Erfolgsfall an gemeinnützige Stiftungen weiter geben, die helfen Blindheit zu vermeiden, zudem spenden wir ein Paar DeepSight, jedes Mal, wenn biolnic über Ihre Spenden $500 eingenommen hat.
80% der Umwelteindrücke nehmen wir über das gesunde Auge wahr. Wir arbeiten
akribisch daran, unsere
Lebensqualität im Alter mit DeepSight entscheidend verbessern und
damit aktiver leben zu können.
Unterstützen Sie uns dabei, hier oder bald auf biolnic.com.


Inhalt


Ein bisschen Medizin zuerst


Wie die DeepSight funktioniert



Was die DeepSight einzigartig machen soll


Wer hinter DeepSight steht

Arbeit die wir machen


Unsere tollen Partner


Herausforderungen die zu meistern sind


Gehen wir es an – wir brauchen Sie! (Perks)


News


Synopse


Häufig gestellte Fragen


Zum Anfang



Ein bisschen Medizin zuerst

Die natürliche Linse


Die Linse des menschlichen Auges ist ein kristallklarer, extrem elastischer Körper, der das durch
die
Pupille eintretende Licht auf der Netzhaut in ein scharfes Bild bündelt. Sie ist in einem
hauchdünnen
„Kapselsack“ gelagert, welcher über seitlich in den Äquator der Kapsel einstrahlende Zonula-
fasern am
ringförmigen Ziliarmuskel aufgehängt ist.



Der Graue Star und die Alterssichtigkeit

Eine besonders gravierende und langsam fortschreitende Erkrankung ist der Graue Star
(„Katarakt“),
bei der es zur Trübung der Augenlinse kommt. Die Folgen sind eine erhöhte Blendempfindlichkeit
des
Auges und die verblasste Wahrnehmung von Farben. Der fortgeschrittene Graue Star kann nur
operativ
behandelt werden, indem die natürliche Linse nach Öffnung des Kapselsacks durch eine -
künstliche -
Intraokularlinse (IOL) ausgetauscht wird.



Die Alterssichtigkeit („Presbyopie“) ist der altersbedingte Verlust der
Anpassungsfähigkeit
des Auges an unterschiedliche Gegenstandsweiten (Akkommodation). Im Wesentlichen beruht dies auf
einem Elastizitätsverlust des Linsenkerns. Die Korrektur erfolgt in der Regel mit einer oder
mehreren Brillen.




Die Akkommodation


Bei der Akkommodation, dem Scharfstellen des Auges, übt der ringförmige Muskel („Ziliar“) nicht,
wie
man annehmen könnte, eine Kraft auf die Linse aus. Stattdessen entspannen sich bei Kontraktion
des
Ziliar die Zonulafasern und die Linse stellt sich in ihre kugelige Eigenform für die Nahsicht
zurück. Magnetresonanztomographie (MRT)-Untersuchungen zeigen, dass die Durchmesseränderung des Ziliar bei der Akkommodation
sich nur relativ geringfügig zwischen jung zu alt unterscheidet und bei etwa
0,6mm liegt.




Herkömmliche IOL’s


Standard Intraokularlinsen (IOL’s) haben nur einen Fokus, womit man entweder nur nah oder fern
sehen
kann.

Daneben gibt es Bifokal- bzw. Multifokallinsen mit mehreren Fokussen, die zwar wie die Standard
IOL’s
nicht völlig starr sind, jedoch nicht akkommodieren und ihre Form verändern können. Der Nachteil
der
Multifokallinsen liegt in dem deutlich schlechteren Kontrastsehvermögen und erhöhter
Blendempfindlichkeit (insbesondere bei Nacht). Ähnlich wie bei Gleitsichtbrillen ist zudem der
Sehbereich kleiner, welches ein unphysiologisches Schaukeln des Kopfes nach sich zieht.




Komplikationen von IOL’s

Die häufigste Komplikation bei der Verwendung von Intraokularlinsen ist die Eintrübung der
Hinterkapsel,
der „Nachstar“. Dieser erfordert einen zusätzlichen operativen Eingriff mittels eines Lasers.




Akkommodierbare IOL’s

Anders als vielfach angenommen kann die Akkommodation des Auges bislang nicht zufriedenstellend
wiederhergestellt werden! Es werden nur Brechkraftänderungen von etwa 1,5 Dioptrien erreicht;
für die
Nah- bis Fernsicht sind jedoch mindestens 3 Dioptrien nötig.

Durchdachte biomechanische Lösungen fehlen, bei denen die Funktion des Scharfstellens möglichst
exakt der
Natur nachgeahmt wird. Und zwar ohne dass sich Auge oder Gehirn umstellen müssten oder es zu
(optischen)
Fehlleistungen kommen könnte und ohne elektronische Hilfsmittel!

Weiteres Manko: Der durch die Öffnung „beschädigte“ Kapselsack kann eine flexible IOL nur
sehr
eingeschränkt in ihren flachen Zustand für die Fernsicht zusammendrücken.




Neue Standards setzen

Viel effizienter ist die Kraftübertragung, die hinter der Konstruktion und dem Design der DeepSight steckt! Hier soll die IOL direkt an den Ziliarmuskel
angekoppelt werden.


Inhaltsverzeichnis



Wie die „DeepSight“ funktioniert
Der Natur in die Seele geschaut




Wie sie funktionieren soll


Die linsenförmige DeepSight ist wie ihr natürliches Vorbild im
Fernzustand flach. Sie besteht aus einer dünnen, äußerst elastischen Schale mit einem flüssigen,
hoch-lichtbrechenden Kern. Der Ziliarmuskel schmiegt sich um den „Haptikring“, den Rand der IOL.
Dieser
kann aufgrund der dünnen Schlitze der Kontraktion des Ziliar folgen. Die DeepSight wird runder: nahe Objekte werden scharf
abgebildet!






Unsere Simulationen (optische sowie Spannungs- und Verformungsanalysen) zeigen, dass mit der
bioinspirierten DeepSight schon bei weniger als der halben
Durchmesseränderung des Ziliar von nur 0,2mm ein mehrfaches an Brechkraftänderung als der
benötigten 3
Dioptrien für Nah- bis Fernsicht erzielt werden könnte. Dies soll in der klinischen Prüfung
belegt
werden.




Wie die DeepSight implantiert werden soll


Die DeepSight soll sich ähnlich unkompliziert implantieren lassen
wie herkömmliche IOL’s, wobei dies nur etwa 10 min. dauert. Zur Implantation wird der Kapselsack entfernt oder hinter die
Intraokularlinse
verschoben. Die DeepSight wird in den Ziliarmuskel eingesetzt.
Sie
kann zudem am Ziliar oder dem Augapfel befestigt werden. Für den Implantationsvorgang wird die
Linse
flach gedrückt, die Füllung dadurch in einen angekoppelten Schlauch überführt und klein
aufgerollt.



Inhaltsverzeichnis


Was die DeepSight einzigartig machen soll
Die DeepSight besticht in der Summe der Details durch die Einfachheit des
Designs in Form eines
bioinspirierten Systems, welches der menschlichen Physiologie sehr nahekommt. Die Form der IOL verändert sich - als Maß für die Brechkraftänderung - sogar deutlich stärker als die der natürlichen Linse, von einem nahezu ebenen Fernzustand in einen sehr stark gekrümmten Nahzustand.

Diese Alleinstellungsmerkmale sind unser Ziel

Natürliches, scharfes Sehen von 25 cm bis Fern ohne zusätzliche Sehhilfen,
Gesichtsfeldeinschränkung
und Umstellung von Auge oder Gehirn.


Die DeepSight soll die Muskelkontraktion maximal ausnutzen,
indem sie vollständig vom Ziliar
umschlossen wird und durch die Schlitze im Haptikring und dem flüssigen Kern äußerst verformbar
ist.

Die sehr große Optik ermöglicht ein signifikant besseres Nachtsichtverhalten.
Der Nachstar oder eine Dezentrierung sind weit weniger wahrscheinlich.
Sie soll auch Patienten mit starker Fehlsichtigkeit helfen.
Langfristig niedrigere Kosten im Vergleich zu sonstigen Sehhilfen.
Patienten mit konventioneller IOL können sich diese durch eine DeepSight ersetzen lassen.




Wer hinter DeepSight steht
Wir sind ein Team aus biomedizinischen und wissenschaftlichen Experten, deren Kick darin liegt,
Technologien zu
nutzen, dass Menschen sich in unsere Linsen verlieben




Wir, Andreas, Ben und Josef kennen uns aus dem von der Europäischen Union geförderten Projekt COTECH (www.fp7-cotech.eu).


Dr. Josef Jansen ist der Gründer der biolnic und Kopf der DeepSight. Als Maschinenbau-
ingenieur
(Dissertation
über künstliche Herzklappen) beschäftigt er sich seit 30 Jahren mit der Entwicklung von der Natur
nachgeahmten Implantaten für den menschlichen Körper. Seine Kernkompetenz liegt in der Analyse und
dem
Verständnis der Wirkungsweise von hochbeanspruchten Körperteilen und deren technisch-konstruktiver
Umsetzung
in ein physiologiegerechtes, biomechanisches Design mit naturnaher Elastizität. Josef verbindet
höchste
technische Ansprüche mit der Einfachheit von Lösungen aus der Natur. Visionäre und innovative
Produktentwicklungen sind seine Leidenschaft. Und diese kommen häufig aus kleinen, innovativen
Unternehmen,
die in diesem Spezialbereich oft mehr Kompetenz, Flexibilität und Kontinuität gewährleisten.




Dr. Andreas Schoth ist Physiker und Ingenieur und der wissenschaftliche Experte auf dem Gebiet
der
Mikrosystemtechnik. Er ist seit seiner Dissertation über quantenmechanische Siliziumsensoren im
Jahre 1995
in diesem innovativen Gebiet zu Hause. Frei nach Richard Feynmans "There is Plenty of Room at the
Bottom"
(Ganz unten ist eine Menge Platz), erforscht und entwickelt Andreas Fertigungstechnologien für
unterschiedliche Anwendungen; vom „Lab on the Chip“ zu hochminiaturisierten Implantaten. Dazu gehört
auch
als ein Beispiel, dass Mikro-und Nanospritzgiessen von smarten Materialien.




Dr. Ben Whiteside überwindet seit 2001 immer wieder die Grenzen des
Ultrapräzisionsspritzgusses. Die
mechanischen Eigenschaften von Polymerverbundstoffen war Thema seiner Dissertation. Danach
beschäftigte er
sich über zehn Jahre als Forscher und Dozent mit Computermodellierungen von Polymerprozessen,
Prozessdatenerfassung von Polymerfertigungssystemen, Hochgeschwindigkeitsbilderfassung und der
Entwicklung
von Visualisierungstechnik ebenso wie mit der Fertigung von Polymerkomponenten im Mikro- und
Nanobereich.
Zurzeit ist Ben Direktor am Centre for Micro and Nano Moulding an der Universität Bradford, das sich
als
weltweit einzigartige Einrichtung mit der Fertigung von Nanopräzisionsinstrumenten aus einer breiten
Materialpalette beschäftigt.


Inhaltsverzeichnis


Arbeit die wir machen



Wir scheuen keine Mühen, um sicher zu stellen, dass nichts unversucht bleibt auf unserer Suche nach dem
besten
Weg für eine akkommodative IOL

Wo wir stehen


Das Design der IOL wurde für die Ankoppelung an den Ziliarmuskel entwickelt. Hierbei sind wir
bereits
durch einen langen Prozess gegangen, in dem vielzählige Designs der DeepSight
mit aufwendigen
Berechnungsprogrammen simuliert wurden. Zudem konnte ein Prototyp einer für die Implantation in
den
Kapselsack vorgesehenen, äußerst komplex geformten IOL mit modernsten Mikrotechnologien
gefertigt werden
- mit einem Partner aus Bradford in dem europäischen Projekt COTECH (www.fp7-cotech.eu).




Was zu tun ist



Viel Arbeit steht noch vor uns. Die Mikropräzisionsfertigungs- technik sowie das Design der
DeepSight
werden hinsichtlich des Kunststoffs weiter optimiert und aufeinander abgestimmt. Verschiedenste
Prüfungen und Tests werden durchgeführt. Erste Vorserienmodelle der DeepSight
werden dann in einer
„klinischen Pilotstudie“ an 10 Patienten untersucht, in der die Akkommodationsfähigkeit der IOL
über
ein halbes Jahr aufgezeigt wird (bis Mitte 2017). Hierfür benötigt biolnic rund $2.1 Mio. (1,7€
Mio.). Und
dafür
brauchen wir Sie!

Die anschließende, umfassende klinische Prüfung an etwa 400 Patienten soll rund 2 Jahre dauern.
Parallel
wird die automatisierte Serienfertigung aufgebaut. Dies kann über Finanzierungsprogramme der EU
gedeckt
werden. Danach soll die „Verkehrsfähigkeit“ der DeepSight Linse
als
Medizinprodukt in der
Europäischen
Union erreicht werden und der Verkauf über Partner aus der Industrie beginnen.



Die Serienfertigung – Qualität kennt keine
Kompromisse


Die Serien-Fertigung der DeepSight wird biolnic voraussichtlich
selbst vornehmen und zusammen mit den
Partnern aufbauen.

Denn: Absolut höchste Qualitätsmaßstäbe stehen immer im Vordergrund!



Inhaltsverzeichnis


Unsere tollen Partner
Die enge Zusammenarbeit mit hervorragenden Partnern ermöglicht uns Weltklasse-Arbeit
biolnic wird bei der Entwicklung der Mikrofertigungstechnologien mit kompetenten Partnern aus dem
EU-Projekt
COTECH kooperieren.

Das COTECH Projekt


biolnic führt die Entwicklungen über akkommodierbare Intraokularlinsen der Firma be innovative
basierend
auf
dem von der Europäischen Union geförderten Projekt COTECH (2008-2012: „Converging technologies
for micro systems
manufacturing“, www.fp7-cotech.eu) fort. In COTECH wurden von 25
europäischen Partnern völlig neue Mikrofertigungstechnologien entwickelt. Der „Demonstrator“ der
be
innovative war eine in den Kapselsack implantierbare akkommodierbare IOL mit verformbaren
Optiken. Die
IOL
wurde aus zwei verschieden geformten asphärischen Halbschalen gefertigt und zusammengefügt.









Das Centre for Polymer Micro and Nano Technology an der Universität Bradford (UK) ist seit
2001
international anerkannt für bahnbrechende Forschung im Bereich Mikrospritzguss. Es verfügt über ein
umfassendes Sortiment an modernsten Verarbeitungsanlagen, die speziell zur Fertigung von Micro- und
Nanopräzisionskomponenten im industriellen Maßstab konzipiert wurde. So wurden maßgeschneiderte
Systeme zum
Monitoring des Verhaltens von Rohmaterialen und der Maschinendynamik in Produktionsprozessen
entwickelt.
Weitere neuartige Sensortechnologien und Datenerfassungssysteme ermöglichen eine lückenlose
Rückverfolgbarkeit der Produktionsumgebung bei der Produktfertigung. Dies ist besonders in der
Medizinproduktbranche von großer Bedeutung. Das Zentrum verfügt außerdem über ein eigens
eingerichtetes
Labor zur Charakterisierung (z.B. zur Bestimmung von Form und mechanischen Eigenschaften von
Mikrogusskomponenten und Oberflächeneigenschaften). Ein hochqualifiziertes Team bietet das zur
Entwicklung
neuer Verfahren und Technologien benötigte Know-how, um die Herausforderungen zur Herstellung
modernster
Geräte zu bewältigen.








Das Institut für Mikrosystemtechnik (IMTEK) der Albert-Ludwigs-Universität Freiburg ist ein
international
führendes Institut auf dem Gebiet der Lebenswissenschaften, Brain-Computer-Interface und der
Mikro-/Nanotechnologie. Das IMTEK verfügt über detailliertes Wissen und Erfahrungen im Bereich der
Kunststoffabformung mit Sub-Mikrometer Genauigkeit und in der Fertigung von hochpräzisen Spritzgieß-
und
Prägeformen mit optischen Oberflächen.








Das Institut für Experimentelle Ophthalmologie (Univ.-Prof. Dr. rer. nat. Dr. med. Solon
Thanos) ist
eine
anerkannte Forschungseinrichtung der Westfälischen Wilhelms-Universität Münster. Die Arbeitsgruppe
beherrscht das Gebiet der klinischen und experimentellen Ophthalmologie. Bioverträglichkeitsstudien,
in
vitro Kulturen von Nerven-, Linsen- und Hornhautzellen werden routinemäßig durchgeführt.


Inhaltsverzeichnis


Herausforderungen die zu meistern sind
Große Ideen benötigen starke Strategien zur Verwirklichung

Naturgemäß bestehen bei der Entwicklung von neuen Implantaten für den menschlichen Körper vielfältige
medizintechnische Risiken und Herausforderungen:

Der Mikrospritzguss hochelastischer optischer Präzisionsbauteile und damit die Fertigung der
DeepSight sind äußerst anspruchsvoll, aber mit unseren
kompetenten
Partnern aus dem COTECH-Projekt
umsetzbar.

Die Akkommodation der DeepSight muss sich im Rahmen der
klinischen Prüfungen am Menschen ausreichend
zeigen. Wir sind davon überzeugt, dass dies gelingt.

Ferner hängt die präzise Auswahl der korrekten Größe der IOL für den Ziliarmuskel von der
Sorgfalt
des Arztes und geeigneter bildgebender Verfahren ab. Präzision und Sorgfalt sind Augenärzte
jedoch
gewöhnt.

Das Langzeitverhalten von Implantaten lässt sich generell nie im Voraus 100%ig zuverlässig
bewerten.
Es sollte jedoch so sein wie bei herkömmlichen IOL’s.


Gewiss soll hier auch darauf hingewiesen werden, dass es bei solchen Projekten vorkommen kann, dass
Entwicklungsschritte, Tests oder sogar klinische Prüfungen wiederholt werden müssen. Dies kann im
schlimmsten Fall bis zum Scheitern der Unternehmung infolge der Nichterreichung der
Verkehrsfähigkeit der
Linsen als Medizinprodukte führen, wodurch Ihre Option verloren gehen würde. Wir werden aber
selbstverständlich unser Bestes tun, dass dies nicht eintritt, können ein solches worst-case
Szenario jedoch
keinesfalls sicher ausschließen.

Inhaltsverzeichnis


Gehen wir es an – wir brauchen Sie! (Perks)
Lasst uns gemeinsam etwas Großartiges tun

Wenn das Projekt durch Ihre Unterstützung durchgeführt wird, könnte mit der DeepSight
ein Durchbruch in der
Behandlung der Alterssichtigkeit und des Grauen Star erzielt werden. Durch das natürliche, junge
Sehen von
nah bis fern könnten Sie entscheidende Lebensqualität zurückgewinnen: Visuelle Reize uneingeschränkt
genießen, regere Aktivität und Erhalt der geistigen Leistungsfähigkeit bis ins hohe Alter.
Einlösen können Sie die folgenden Optionen über Ihren Augenarzt (Augenklinik) frühestens nach
Erlangung der
Verkehrsfähigkeit der DeepSight Linsen zu einem Zeitpunkt, den Sie
selbst bestimmen. Die Option ist auch
übertragbar auf z.B. die Oma, den Partner ... – aus welchen Gründen auch immer.
Wir begeistern uns sehr für dieses Projekt und hoffen, dass Sie das auch tun. Wir schätzen
Ihre Unterstützung
und würden uns sehr freuen, wenn Sie DeepSight Ihren Freunden
weiterleiten würden!
Perks (Anreize)


Spende (Donation): Wir sind Ihnen sehr dankbar für Ihre Unterstützung. Jede Ihrer Spenden werden wir im Erfolgsfall an gemeinnützige Stiftungen wie Vision 2020, Ärzte ohne Grenzen, christoffel blindenmission, BigShoe etc. weitergeben, die Menschen helfen, die besonders aufgrund von angeborenem oder kindlichem Grauen Star oder anderer Augenerkrankungen von Blindheit gefährdet sind. Zudem werden wir ein Paar DeepSight Linsen (prognostizierter Marktwert $5.000) spenden, jedes Mal, wenn biolnic über Ihre Spenden $500 eingenommen hat.
Vielen Dank! Ihr Name wird auf
unserer Webseite in einer Liste der Spender erscheinen (außer Sie wünschen lieber anonym zu
bleiben).
Für eine $500 Option (~400€) erhalten Sie ein Paar IOL (mit 90% Rabatt bei anvisiertem
Verkaufspreis pro Paar von $5.000/~4.000€) und sparen bei späterer Inanspruchnahme $4.500
(~3.600€). 

Für eine $125 Option (~100€) erhalten Sie 20% Rabatt auf ein Paar IOL bei einer späteren
Inanspruchnahme. Sie zahlen bei anvisiertem Verkaufspreis pro Paar von $5.000 (~4.000€) dann für
2 IOL noch $3.875 (~3.100€) [4.000€ - 20% - Optionspreis] und sparen somit $1.000 (~800€). 

Für eine $310 Option (~250€) erhalten Sie 40% Rabatt auf ein Paar IOL bei einer späteren
Inanspruchnahme. Sie zahlen bei anvisiertem Verkaufspreis pro Paar von $5.000 (~4.000€) für 2
IOL dann noch $2.690 (~2.150€) [4.000€ - 40% - Optionspreis] und sparen somit $2.000
(~1.600€). 

Wir haben uns für US-Dollar als Kampagnen Währung entschieden, da Sie so einfach mit Ihrer
Kreditkarte zahlen können, ohne über das Portal Paypal gehen zu müssen.
Mit den obigen Optionen erhalten Sie eine beliebige Ausführung einer akkommodierbaren
Intraokularlinse der biolnic. Dies beinhaltet z.B. eine Variante der DeepSight mit UV-Filterschutz
oder eine Ausführung, die bestimmte Sehfehler ausgleichen, wie z.B. eine Hornhautverkrümmung
(Astigmatismus).
Wie in der Kampagne beschrieben, handelt es sich bei dem DeepSight Projekt um ein
Entwicklungsvorhaben, in dem die Verkehrsfähigkeit der DeepSight erlangt werden soll. Einen Erfolg
können wir aber nicht garantieren. Für den Fall also, dass uns dies trotz aller gemeinsamen
Anstrengungen nicht gelingen sollte, muss die Option leider verfallen. Erwerber außerhalb der EU
sind selbst für die Entrichtung einer Mehrwertsteuer verantwortlich (siehe FAQ).


Inhaltsverzeichnis


News

Wir bedanken uns vielmals bei InmediasP (Berlin) für die großartige Unterstützung bei der Erstellung der Webseite der biolnic und dieser Kampagnenseite sowie der Animationen im Pitch-Video.


Inhaltsverzeichnis



Inhaltsverzeichnis


FAQ – Häufig gestellte Fragen

Top

story:
More people than ever are beginning to embrace entrepreneurship and freelancing over the corporate world. This in itself is exciting, but lets take a look at what Peter Diamandis had to say about the future of entrepreneurship and the changes to come: 

"The ability to build a business has gotten easier and cheaper. And the ability to create a product or service and quickly scale it to a million--or a billion--consumers is something that's possible today that wasn't possible even a decade ago. Today, entrepreneurs have access to technologies that were once available only to large organizations or governments. Plus, entrepreneurs now have access to a huge amount of capital--from VCs and the angel community as well as crowdfunding, which is expected to reach $15 billion in 2015. I think we're going to see an explosion in entrepreneurship, an explosion in innovation. That, to me, is why this next decade is extraordinarily exciting." Peter Diamandis via Inc. http://www.inc.com/magazine/201412/diana-ransom-and-liz-welch/going-full-tilt-entrepreneurship-peter-diamandis.html 

We have created Assist 2 Develop to help the entrepreneurs, freelancers, and small businesses who manufacture products to create the explosion in innovation that Peter is speaking of.

Assist 2 Develop is a freelance marketplace dedicated to engineering & manufacturing and we are excited to revolutionize the way amazing products come to life. Many of the innovative products you use everyday & see on INDIEGOGO are created because of the amazing people who create & shape the world we live in. They are known as engineers, manufacturing professionals, disruptors, makers, & innovators. Small businesses & entrepreneurs creating physical products rely on these people to design & manufacture the innovative products we all love & below you will see that our economy does too. We have created Assist 2 Develop to help these parties to connect, collaborate in real time, and create innovative products. 

What is The Inspiration Behind Your Product? 

What inspired me to create A2D (Assist 2 Develop) was seeing how the economic collapse in 2008 pushed more and more talented engineers to pick up freelance work out of necessity. Multi national company lay offs, offshoring product development / manufacturing, and in some cases maintaining corporate profits lead to the loss of jobs and this need for something different. Local economies were devastated and to understand why we can turn to the Bureau of economic analysis which has said that manufacturing has a larger multiplier effect than any other major economic activity. $1 spent in manufacturing generates $1.35 in additional economic activity. http://manufacturing.gov/mfg_in_context.html So I created Assist 2 Develop to help reinvigorate local economies by bringing freelance engineering & manufacturing professionals together with small businesses to create and manufacture the innovative products we all love and use every day. 


What Problem Does Your Product Solve? 

According to a report published in HBR 75% of freelance work still comes via word of mouth http://blogs.hbr.org/2014/10/the-freelance-economy-still-runs-on-word-of-mouth/ and the independent worker or freelancer category is growing faster than the overall labor force. 

But we all know that engineers aren’t the most social people in the world (worked with them for 7+ years), so almost all of their work comes from word of mouth. In the evolving digital world can freelance engineers find enough sustainable work to live comfortably?  On the flip side entrepreneurs and small businesses have utilized freelancers to create their products more often since 2008 because it’s more cost effective, but how do they find the right person for the job? Too often small businesses and entrepreneurs waste time and money contracting a freelancer who didn't exactly deliver, so they end up having to rework entire design. And once the parties do connect the next big challenge is communication breakdowns, because that causes delays, and in today’s competitive global economy any delay can be very detrimental to your products success. Most communication between freelancers and small businesses happens via email and phone which doesn't foster a innovative and collaborative process. 

How Does Your Product Solve This Problem & Make a Positive Impact?

A2D is a freelance marketplace that helps bring the necessary parties together and allows them to collaborate in real time. We have a specific vetting process that allows engineers to show their skills and prove they are worth the investment and that helps entrepreneurs and companies find the top freelance talent. Dynamic notifications (text and / or email) can be sent informing each party the status of a bid placed by the freelancer and when the company accepts the bid they can send a non disclosure agreement to ensure their data is protected. 

Once connected both parties can collaborate in real time using our digital workspace (shown below). This gives our customers the ability to conduct design reviews, send messages internal to the system, and share screens / webcams all in the name of accelerating the product development process & manufacturing awesome products. Assist 2 Develop allows both parties to connect, collaborate, and innovate which helps companies create & manufacture amazing products, create jobs, and stimulate local economies. 



Internet Of Things Impact & Opportunity For Entreprenerurs & Freelancers

Advances in technology and the emergence of the internet of things will lead to more connected devices, which equals greater opportunity for product development professionals. Assist 2 Develop can be the tool to connect companies to the innovators who create the amazing products of the future.


What Do You Need To Raise? 

$40,000 

How Will The Money Be Used? 

To develop our next generation tool that includes a mobile / tablet application and other collaborative features that will fulfill the needs of our users that we have identified in the past year including video bids, embedded CAD tools, online training for engineering & manufacturing pro's, and a built in simple to use file management system. 

We also want to build features to incorporate different freelancers into the collaborative process. Once the prototype is created and engineering is complete we want the companies / entrepreneurs to be able to reach out to other parties looking to collaborate and help bring their product to market. The big picture goal is to allow companies to build a digital team starting with engineering & manufacturing professionals, but has the ability to expand to marketing, sales, web development, distribution companies, & any other freelancer or small business that can help get the prototyped / manufactured product to market. The focus is still built around manufacturing, because manufacturing creates these jobs, but these supporting roles are essential.  

Can't Make a Donation, But Still Want To Contribute?

Get out and spread the word about the Assist 2 Develop by sharing this link on social media or email with your friends / colleagues. 

What Is The Next Step For Assist 2 Develop? 

We are currently in a private beta / alpha stage and continuing to develop the platform, but we are looking to release the first version of Assist 2 Develop in Q1 2015. It doesn't look pretty, but it is fully functional and easy to use. Our biggest step will be to create a mobile / tablet application for Assist 2 Develop users. We will begin working on this in Q1 2015 and your contributions can help us reach this milestone. 

Who Are You? 

My name is Bassanio Peters and I am the founder and CEO of Assisted Development LLC and the man behind the Assist 2 Develop tool. I wanted to give anyone with an idea for a product the tools and resources to turn that idea into reality.

https://www.linkedin.com/profile/view?id=84607214&trk=nav_responsive_tab_profile
https://twitter.com/BassanioA2D

What is Your Background? 

I am a business development professional with 7 years experience in the engineering and manufacturing industry including owning a product development firm where I helped contract engineers find work. 

A few testimonials from our customers / partners:

We helped Gloria find a partner to conduct an FEA analysis on a product she is currently developing. Here is what she had to say about her experience: 

" I just wanted to say that in the 4 years I've been on this journey you are the second company that assessed and produced in a timely manner. I'm happy to have worked with you and your company."  

Gloria Ekelchik (Inventor)

Working together with Solid Concepts we have been able to turn many entrepreneurs ideas into a physical product. Here is what Sara Kloos from Solid Concepts had to say about us:

"I met with Bassanio Peters a few months ago and I have to say I am so impressed! He is my go-to guy for all customers that need design work done from any stage in the design process. I send him a basic overview of the project and he matches the customer up with an appropriate engineer with experience in the product line. He is reliable, resourceful and respondent." 

Sarah Kloos from Solid Concepts

We are currently in a private beta / alpha stage and continuing to develop the platform, but we are looking to release the first version of Assist 2 Develop in Q1 2015. It doesn't look pretty, but it is fully functional and easy to use. Our biggest step will be to create a mobile / tablet application for Assist 2 Develop users. We will begin working on this in Q1 2015 and your contributions can help us reach this milestone. 

Who Are You? 
My name is Bassanio Peters and I am the founder and CEO of Assisted Development LLC and the man behind the Assist 2 Develop tool. I wanted to give anyone with an idea for a product the tools and resources to turn that idea into reality.

https://www.linkedin.com/profile/view?id=84607214&trk=nav_responsive_tab_profile

https://twitter.com/BassanioA2D

What is Your Background? 
I am a business development professional with 7 years experience in the engineering and manufacturing industry including owning a product development firm where I helped contract engineers find work. 
A few testimonials from our customers / partners:

We helped Gloria find a partner to conduct an FEA analysis on a product she is currently developing. Here is what she had to say about her experience: 
" I just wanted to say that in the 4 years I've been on this journey you are the second company that assessed and produced in a timely manner. I'm happy to have worked with you and your company."  
Gloria Ekelchik (Inventor)
Working together with Solid Concepts we have been able to turn many entrepreneurs ideas into a physical product. Here is what Sara Kloos from Solid Concepts had to say about us:
"I met with Bassanio Peters a few months ago and I have to say I am so impressed! He is my go-to guy for all customers that need design work done from any stage in the design process. I send him a basic overview of the project and he matches the customer up with an appropriate engineer with experience in the product line. He is reliable, resourceful and respondent." 
Sarah Kloos from Solid Concepts

story:
VirtKick wraps awkard virtualization technology in a convenient, usable panel. VirtKick does to open source what DigitalOcean did to SaaS. Simplicity and privacy are our core goals. We're currently alpha and the code is on GitHub.

VPS providers can read your data without you noticing that. Disk encryption won't help, since the key is stored in memory and they can read it as well. VirtKick lets you take cloud back and become your own VPS provider.


Data center is probably the best place for VirtKick. Dedicated servers are very reliable and cost-effective. They also offer an acceptable level of privacy as long as you encrypt your disks and type your passphrase on boot.

Sure dedicated servers won't protect you from server implants. Police could also hot replug and take your server to their lab to retrieve the encryption key from the memory. Install VirtKick on your computer or home server to get the highest level of privacy. It's no longer a cloud, but it's all yours and secure.


Imagine you don't need any previous knowledge to play with virtualization on your desktop or real servers. That's what VirtKick is all about. All the required components are already bundled, or automatically installed in your system. VirtKick requires little knowledge to start - you're just one click ahead!

The technologies involved are just an implementation detail. KVM and OpenVZ run virtual machines, whereas libvirt is an abstraction layer to these two. Docker lets us make use of great images in Registry Hub. And Ansible is here to auto-configure hypervisors. We combine them all together to deliver an amazing cloud panel that does the job.

We didn't forget about regular users without bare metal servers. VirtKick ships with optional e-commerce features, so VPS providers can use them to sell machines. This way we ensure VirtKick goodies are available for anyone. What's most important, you'll be able to migrate your machines between VPS providers.

Users deserve a cool, open source, privacy-enabled cloud panel for the modern Internet. VirtKick is a very ambitious but doable plan. Thanks for your support!


A Bonus is a complete set of features that integrates with third party services. That makes VirtKick a complete solution for professionals and businesses.

For every $20,000 raised we'll implement one Bonus. $75+ backers decide which by voting!

Spread the word about VirtKick and get packages for more than only 2 Linux distros. Each 1000 stars, followers or likes is one extra Linux distro!



Development process goes public on GitHub. VirtKick is licensed under GNU AGPL. Anybody is able to download it and use for free - even commercially.

Additionally, $199+ backers will receive a non-copyleft license for the sources. This may be useful for companies that want to develop their own modules and keep them secret. Most companies should be fine with the default license.

There will be a testing deployment of VirtKick. We'll grant access to every $25+ backer. There won't be any specific releases - the development will be continuous. A new version will be deployed any time the automated tests pass,

Our $99+ backers will get exclusive access to pre-releases of Linux packages and virtual appliances. They will go public after one month. Still, package sources will be public at all times. 100% open source - remember.


A lot of real code is already written and published on GitHub. But don't take our word for it - just have a look at the hosted alpha and give it a try! It offers a limited set of features, but is a great proof that VirtKick really works.

Technically, it's a server-side generated Rails web-application with some alive parts in AngularJS. On the backend there's WebVirtMgr that acts as a RESTful proxy to libvirt (we'll later replace it with Fog.io). Background tasks are ran with Delayed::Job, though we might switch do Sidekiq in future (it's no effort thanks to ActiveJob abstraction introduced in Rails 4.2 beta). Instead of relying on Apache or nginx, we make use of http-master, a web server implemented in node.js. It's also used to serve VNC on websockets (Websockify and noVNC are involved).

One-click install & auto-configuration is one of our core features. At the moment, we almost achieved it on desktop environments, where the local machine is the hypervisor. All you need is to execute virtkick-start command and type your password when asked for sudo. But we don't mess with your OS very much - we only create a new user, install a few packages and configure libvirt. Crucial parts of VirtKick we depend on are either installed in the system (Python) or in VirtKick directory (Ruby from RVM, Node.js from NVM). After you open VirtKick in your browser, we create a network, initialize storage pools and download ISO images of most popular Linux distros. VirtKick doesn't run as root.

Additionally, we've got a static prototype with most planned features. The user interface is already prototyped and designed. Click through the application yourself at demo.virtkick.io and get familiar with all planned features.

Here's what VirtKick will let you do after we implement Basic Bundle:

  • create accounts for users and administrators
  • create and start using a VM in no more than 59 seconds
  • manage your VM - start, stop, restart, mount ISO, create disk, etc.
  • let other users manage your VM
  • everything with a simple, lightweight and comfortable UI
Next Bundles add more and more features on top of it. One thing remains the same - all is still simple!

This is what you should expect from VirtKick once we implement Basic Bundle:

  • support for KVM through libvirt
  • distros available by default: Ubuntu, Debian, CentOS, CoreOS, Arch, FreeBSD
    • ready to use appliance with SSH key copied onto the VM
    • mount ISO as CD and install yourself
  • one-click install with reasonable default values
  • auto-configure hypervisors
  • import existing libvirt domains
  • IP reservation, clean-traffic nwfilter applied to every VM
  • add additional disks
  • access console with noVNC
  • packages for 2+ Linux distributions (see Social Stretch Goals for more)
  • appliances or images for Docker, VirtualBox and Qemu-KVM
  • Facebook integration ;-)

Other Bundles should be pretty self-explanatory, but drop us a line if in doubt!



For the service fees and hardware maintenance:

  • For hardware to actually test VirtKick on. As part of release process we want to run automated infrastructure tests. We'll test VirtKick against multiple distros and multiple virtualization technologies. We'll need at least 10 cheap bare metal servers, which is around $600 a month.
  • For Amazon EC2 account to test VirtKick on. If we reach the stretch goal, we'll need it to test the APIs and run integration tests. It will be around $300 a month.
  • For our own servers. We currently have two bare metal servers in collocation - these servers run the hosted instance. We need it to catch unhandled exceptions, spot performance problems and analyze what features people use. It costs us $100 a month.
  • For infrastructure monitoring. We need to know its state and be notified about alerts and problems. New Relic, Pingdom and PubNub will cost us up to $100 a month.
  • For 3rd party services. Since we will be integrating with many external APIs (e.g. helpdesk, transactional e-mails, etc), we will have to subscribe for their paid plans. Depending on how many Bonuses will be implemented, it will cost us from $20 to $200 a month.
  • For placing bounties on BountySource. We'll do that to get some features implemented in 3rd party open source projects that we are not able to handle. Usually $100-$500 for a bounty, but not sure about how many of them there'll be a need to post.

And for the team:

    • For Damian N., the Ruby developer, who codes the Rails webapp, Ruby backend and makes it all speak virtualization.
    • For Damian K., the node.js developer, who codes node.js parts of the project, and who will soon contribute to libvirt project.
    • For Wojtek, the graphic designer, who designs a clean and usable user interface and a lot of artwork for media.
    • For Mateusz, the experienced sysops, who manages our infrastructure and helps us tackle the nasty parts of networks, storage and provisioning.
    • For Mirek, the copywriter, who makes the texts more understandable. ;-)
    The more we raise, the longer we can work on VirtKick and other related projects.

    Damian Nowak, or Nowaker, has been a software developer for 5 years. He spent last 3 years working in hosting-related businesses. He not only knows virtualization from inside-out but also has great ideas on how to simplify it. He adapted "Howdy partner" as his primary greeting and you could easily mistake him for a true cowboy. Husband and father of two kids. Soon three.

    Damian Kaczmarek, or Rush, has been coding embedded devices for 5 years, but found his second calling in node.js. He worked on a big AngularJS project for a year and develops http-master, a node.js HTTP server. After hours he codes various stuff for Unreal Tournament community. The only social website he uses is GitHub. Indiegogo is the first place he has uploaded his real photo. Still, with sunglasses on.


    All funds received here count towards the stretch goals.

    • Donate with Bitcoin:  1Nb7PxyNAKSNc6traXW4NPyPMhJA7PwXf8
    • Donate with DogeCoin:  DLNiai6QZDbAt7n6iUG7pwz842MxE1MTvd
    • Donate with PayPal:  
    • Tip us weekly on Gratipay: 

      Have a question, suggestion or just want to say hello? Leave a comment or drop an e-mail at team@virtkick.io. We'll be happy to answer!


      If you like the idea for VirtKick, please consider spreading a word about the project. Letting your geeky friends know on IRC will probably work best. :) These links may be useful:

      • virtkick.io 
      • github.com/virtkick 
      • twitter.com/virtkick 
      • facebook.com/virtkick 
      • plus.google.com/+VirtKick_io 
      • #virtkick on Freenode

      We'd like to thank the open source community for supporting our efforts. Thank you for spreading the word, testing alpha version, deploying on your servers, finding bugs and encouraging us to run the fundraising!

      These folks gave us a whole lot of valuable feedback on our Indiegogo campaign. Without your help it wouldn't look like this. Thank you very much!

      • Michał Papis, a maintainer of Ruby Version Manager
      • Kenton Varda, an author of Sandstorm.io
      • Maciej Biłas, a co-organizer of Warsaw iBeacon Meetup
      • Andrzej Grzesik, a conference speaker and blogger
      • Jamey Stegmaier, an author of Kickstarter Lessons, without him knowing that ;)

      Credit goes to early supporters. They supported us financially from the very beginning - no matter the only thing we could show was static HTML prototype and our passion.

      • James Arici, the director of BitVPS
      • Jack Davies, the director of TheHostGuys
      • many anonymous donors
      Finally, we'd like to thank companies that provide us with free services. Thanks to them we can develop VirtKick, maintain Hosted Alpha infrastructure or keep in touch with fans. Kudos for open source supporters!
