story:
DeskTech: Kilogram Prototype – A turning point for humanity

In 2018, scientists in Versailles voted to redefine the very measure by which we have based our understanding of weight for the last 139 years. The International Prototype Kilogram was first created in 1889 and is kept under lock and key in a vault in Paris. Scientists have long treated it with the reverence it deserves. They dare not touch it, knowing that it is a highly volatile, yet beautiful representation of weight. 

Despite being made from platinum and iridium, it is known that even the smallest movements and wear can result in tiny imperfections in the weight measure. That is why, in a highly emotional vote, scientists chose to use an alternative standard measurement - universal constants that remain unchanged, regardless of where they are in time and space. As of today, 20 May 2019, the IPK is being retired… an event that deserves recognition.  

The Official International Prototype Kilogram, manufactured in 1889, and carefully stored in Saint-Cloud, Paris

Here at DeskTech we cannot see such a momentous day go unnoticed and so we have developed our own version of the Kilogram Prototype - designed to offer you a piece of history, a conversation starter and a perfect example of how even things we believe to be constant, are ever changing.   

 

'WTF why is it so heavy!?' - Power of Tungsten 

Creating our own Kilogram Prototype took many months of careful development. We needed it to have the shine and polish of the original alongside the required durability and density, but at a lower cost.

  • Tungsten was the perfect choice, it's one of the most dense materials commercially available, even more dense than Uranium.
  • You will most likely never encounter anything this size that weighs this much.
  • It's the ultimate conversation starter, people will be blown away by how heavy it is.

Tungsten is an extremely rare element with just 100 parts per billion contained within the Earth’s crust. It has the highest melting point of any metal at 3,410° C (6,170° F) and as such, it is an incredibly difficult metal to process and work with. However its ability to withstand high levels of compression and heat have made it an ideal alloy for rocket engine nozzles, radiation shielding and aerospace tooling.

 

DeskTech: Kilogram Prototype - a gift for all 

This is a gift that will last a lifetime. Crafted from one of the densest and hardest materials on the planet, these cylinders are beautiful and perfect for anyone who has an interest in STEM (Science Technology Engineering Mathematics). Ideal as a conversation starter in the office or maybe as a corporate gift that will be treasured and given pride of place. 

Students, scientists, mathematicians, engineers and creatives will all admire the work that has gone into this sturdy design-led piece and will find themselves wanting to pick it up. When they do, they will be amazed at how heavy, dense and solid it feels. 

One Kilogram Two Styles

We offer two choices of the Kilogram Prototype to suit your requirements. Each uses all of the same materials and techniques, but provide a different look depending on your decor and style.   

Left: Kilogram Prototype - Classic | Right: Kilogram Prototype - Contemporary

Size Comparison - Left: Kilogram Prototype - Contemporary | Right: Kilogram Prototype - Classic

A Homage to the Original International Kilogram

National prototype kilogram K20, one of two prototypes stored at the US National Institute of Standards and Technology

To the naked eye, our Kilogram Prototype is your very own piece of scientific history. It is the purest example of measurement and an historic homage that truly delivers in terms of beauty and interest. As a desk accessory, it is sublime. 

 

While we could never hope to completely recreate the beauty of the original International Kilogram Prototype, as it was built using a platinum-iridium alloy and cost many hundreds of thousands of dollars. However, with modern techniques, we have been able to reproduce its polished sheen using specialist nickel plating. We achieved the density of the metal with Tungsten, giving it almost exactly the same dimensions as the original. We took our inspiration for the chamfers on the piece from the original four angles (22.5°, 45°, 67.5° and 79°) , giving the item a level of detail that will impress. 

 

DeskTech: Kilogram Prototype – Classic 

If you wish to be inspired by science and to reflect on the great scientific masters while at your desk, this classic version is for you. Heavily influenced by the original International Prototype Kilogram, this features a machined and anodized aluminium base, upon which the Kilogram Prototype rests. A custom-made glass bell jar protects the cylinder and gives it a laboratory-like feel, but with pure beauty and elegance. All parts are carefully considered and fit each other with precision - just like the Kilogram weight itself.   

DeskTech: Kilogram Prototype – Contemporary 

The minimalist style of this contemporary version cannot be understated. With a sleek profile, the Kilogram weight sits upon a machined and anodized aluminium base with a mirror finish logo. This open display allows you to interact with the cylinder - pick it up, marvel at the weight and smooth finish. Unlike the original, this Kilogram Prototype is designed to be played with, not just admired.  

The Rewards

How we made the Kilogram Prototype

Tungsten requires some of the most specialist refinement and production processes of any metal, due to its incredibly high melting point and hardness. Outlined below are the key steps taken by our highly skilled craftspeople as they create a DeskTech Kilogram Prototype.  

The production process:

  • Refinement - The Kilogram Prototype starts life as trace elements in ores, which are then refined through multiple steps into tungsten oxide. From here the tungsten oxide is baked in a hydrogen atmosphere to create pure tungsten powder. 
  • Pressing - The tungsten powder is sifted and added into a giant steel press. The powder is compacted under immense pressure of 60 tons per square inch into a cohesive, yet still fragile bar.
  • Pre-Sintering - The compacted fragile bar is then loaded into an extremely high temperature furnace causing the material to consolidate to roughly 70% of its full density.
  • Full Sintering - The bar is now loaded into a special water-cooled treating bottle. Electric current is passed through the bar and the heat generated by this will cause the bar to densify to about 85% to 95% of full density causing it to shrink by roughly 15%.
  • Swaging - The rod is then heated to 1500oC and passed through a swager die, which is designed to hammer the rod at about 10,000 blows per minute, reducing it’s diameter to nearly the required size.
  • Machining - The rods are then reheated and placed into a CNC lathe and CVD diamond coated tools cut the cylinder to the exact required dimensions and the multiple chamfered edges are applied.
  • Nickel Plating - The Tungsten cylinders are then chemically cleaned and sent for electroless nickel plating, providing a high-quality corrosion-resistant layer.
  • Polishing - Each cylinder is polished using several different buffing wheels and polishing paste, with the surface finish being refined more with each pass. 
  • Laser Engraving - Laser engraving is used to ensure all the details on the top surface appear detailed and crisp.
  • Quality Control - Each cylinder is then carefully inspected for any blemishes before being sent for assembly.  

 

The DeskTech 100% Satisfaction Guarantee  

At DeskTech we pride ourselves on quality and have hundreds of positive reviews piling up from the launch of our first product. We want to make sure you are 100% happy with your DeskTech products. If you feel there are any issues with your product you can contact us directly at support@deskx.co and we will be there to help resolve any issues until you're completely satisfied. 

Risks and challenges

Since the successful launch of our first products under the DeskSpace brand, we've become an established company with reliable vendors and hundreds of positive reviews from happy customers. Our materials have already been sourced, and we have people on the ground to oversee the pre-production runs to make sure everything goes smoothly.

The only remaining risk to backers is that of schedule. Sometimes unforeseen issues can arise during production. If something arises that will take time to fix or rework will opt to push the schedule back slightly to make sure it's done right over shipping a substandard product. We will be in constant communication with you throughout the production process and you will been informed early on if anything unforeseen arises that is going to cause slight delays.

Swaging - The rod is then heated to 1500oC and passed through a swager die, which is designed to hammer the rod at about 10,000 blows per minute, reducing it’s diameter to nearly the required size.
Machining - The rods are then reheated and placed into a CNC lathe and CVD diamond coated tools cut the cylinder to the exact required dimensions and the multiple chamfered edges are applied.
Nickel Plating - The Tungsten cylinders are then chemically cleaned and sent for electroless nickel plating, providing a high-quality corrosion-resistant layer.
Polishing - Each cylinder is polished using several different buffing wheels and polishing paste, with the surface finish being refined more with each pass. 
Laser Engraving - Laser engraving is used to ensure all the details on the top surface appear detailed and crisp.
Quality Control - Each cylinder is then carefully inspected for any blemishes before being sent for assembly.  
 The DeskTech 100% Satisfaction Guarantee  At DeskTech we pride ourselves on quality and have hundreds of positive reviews piling up from the launch of our first product. We want to make sure you are 100% happy with your DeskTech products. If you feel there are any issues with your product you can contact us directly at support@deskx.co and we will be there to help resolve any issues until you're completely satisfied. Risks and challengesSince the successful launch of our first products under the DeskSpace brand, we've become an established company with reliable vendors and hundreds of positive reviews from happy customers. Our materials have already been sourced, and we have people on the ground to oversee the pre-production runs to make sure everything goes smoothly.The only remaining risk to backers is that of schedule. Sometimes unforeseen issues can arise during production. If something arises that will take time to fix or rework will opt to push the schedule back slightly to make sure it's done right over shipping a substandard product. We will be in constant communication with you throughout the production process and you will been informed early on if anything unforeseen arises that is going to cause slight delays.

story:
PayNShow Indiegogo Campaign LIVE Now!

Monday - April 14th

We're working on some of the Best PERKS on Indiegogo and Are Inviting YOU to Join US As We Get Set to Make History!

Here's  Link: 

http://igg.me/at/paynshow


 

Pay N Show will be set to start one of the most interesting and unique campaigns every hosted on Indiegogo, and will be raising funds for its ultra-cool and unique application called Pay N Show using the crowd-funding platform.

Pay N Show promises to be the next big thing according to teenagers and young adults. Pay N Show's novel approach to capturing and sharing pictures of what people buy anywhere makes sharing pictures automated and almost like second nature.

"Have you ever wanted to share a picture of what you just bought with friends and family, but didn't have the time or the patience to stop, set up the picture, and then shoot? For many like me, you're not good at taking pictures or not a picture taking enthusiast. Pay N Show lets you buy and share whatever you want, without the need to take a picture or even learn a new application," said Gary Sada, Founder of Pay N Show.

The way Pay N Show works is simple. Just download the PayNShow app to your iPhone or Android device, then sign up and provide information such as your email address. Now just go to the mall and buy anything.

When you're ready to check out and make your purchase, choose to have your receipt emailed to you. More and more stores are offering this option since it saves money, you'll never lose a receipt again, and its eco-friendly. Its a win - win for everyone!

Instantly, Pay N Show uploads pictures of the items you just bought to your Facebook page - and without the need for you to take a picture. Now, friends and family will see pictures of what you bought. That's not all, your Facebook friends can even load into a shopping basket one or all of the items you bought and ask where online (or offline) they can buy them too!

If you'd like to have an Exclusive on Pay N Show's site via partnering and endorsing, they are inviting companies to join in NOW and create a win/win which will give them exposure too.

Pay N Show is gearing up now and getting set to launch Promotional Campaigns and make history!

Pay N Show's Indiegogo Campaign Kicks off on Monday 4-14-14 at 9am EST- There's lots of cool incentives, a Grand Prize Drawing and many fun things you won't want to miss out on! Get in on the Excitement right here: PREVIEW NOW Link: <br><a href="https://www.indiegogo.com/project/preview/1807211c">https://www.indiegogo.com/project/preview/1807211c</a> Short Link as Campaign goes LIVE Monday 4/14/14: <u><a href="http://igg.me/at/paynshow">http://igg.me/at/paynshow</a></u> Long Link: <u><a href="https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/pay-n-show-share-pictures-of-what-you-buy-without-taking-pictures/x/5975290">https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/pay-n-show-share-pictures-of-what-you-buy-without-taking-pictures/x/5975290</a></u> Pay N Show is also asking that you please help pass this along to all your friends and family and Follow them on Social Media as their mission is to make this VIRAL! Pay N Show is set to make History as they take Shopping to a Whole New Level!

Pay N Show is located in Championsgate, FL and is the developer and licensor of applications like Pay N Show. The Pay N Show company team is comprised of exceptional developers, designers, marketing, and Internet talent.

Please feel free to Contact: Gary Sada <u><a href="mailto:support@paynshow.com">support@paynshow.com</a></u> <u><a href="tel:1-407-495-2640">1-407-495-2640</a></u> <u><a href="http://www.PayNShow.com/">http://www.PayNShow.com</a></u>

story:
The Story

Over our 4.5 years in Korea, we've built an audience of over 312,000 subscribers who are interested in Korean life, food, and culture. Many want to learn Korean as well. While there are plenty of resources out there, there's no ONE place where you can learn everything you need to know, presented by native speakers, and taught the language in its most natural spoken form, so you don't end up speaking like a walking textbook.

A big problem with most language education resources is that they end up teaching you things you'll rarely, if EVER, come across in life. That's a lot of wasted brain space and time. We've built this to be an actual practical and efficient way of learning Korean; no more lists of rarely-ever-used vocabulary, no more learning obscure grammar that comes up once in a blue moon, and no more learning about topics that you have absolutely no interest in.

While some companies focus on the app, they don't give you the learning materials for those who prefer pen and paper. Others may give you videos but no way to test you actually learned anything. Are you an audiophile? Maybe you want to listen on your way to work, at the gym, or while you sleep?

Imagine getting ALL of this in one place. With some topics and phrases that are essential for adult life that these other companies are too scared to teach you!

Welcome to Korean Lesson Time, the most comprehensive and insanely practical way of learning Korean, ever.

What We Need & What You Get

To get everything we need for our MVP to be complete we need:

  • At least ONE highly skilled developer to build the customer account system which deals with the purchase history of courses, course completion statistics, refinements to the game, and enabling some harder to code features in the app.

If we exceed our goal we can :

  • hire more developers to get the product launched quicker
  • get additional upgrades to graphics, music, and sound effects
  • work on more varied game modes for practicing and testing knowledge
  • add extra features we might discover during the building process

Some rewards for you lovely backers include:

  • Special Character sets ONLY for campaign supporters
  • Discounts on all courses available at launch*
  • Your name credited in our Hall of Fame
  • Every course free forever**
  • Your character in the game**

*see tiers for more details

**limited to very exclusive backers

Why We Can't Do It Alone

We've been working on this project since mid January. What started as a small conversation about how we could give better teaching resources with our in-video Korean Lesson Times has blossomed into a fully fledged learning experience. Xander even started to learn how to code for the app development side but some features are too complicated for him at this stage. It's taken so much of our time that we've been neglecting our YouTube channel by uploading less frequently.

  • By hiring an experienced developer (or multiple) we can assure the app is stable and secure
  • Being able to pay our Korean voice actors more for their time and input (it's at least 42 hours of recording for the planned courses! - Yikes!)
  • A bigger team can share more of the work and we can finish the products quicker!

Your contributions, big or small, will aid in the construction of this project. The more we can raise the more people we can hire to get this done quicker.

If we can't get the full goal amount it's ok, we'll keep working on the project and we'll release as soon as the system and app work smoothly with no problems.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, we totally understand. We hope, at least, you could ask others to help us out with this by:

  • Liking the Campaign Launch video on YouTube
  • Sharing this page on Facebook and Twitter.
  • ​Go to a Korean study gorup? Tell them about it 
  • If your friends and family like us, ask them!

Help us spread the word so we can get all the materials finished quicker and to a hopefully even better quality standard :)

Basic Bundle (Retail $50)

The Basic Bundle consists of Korean Lesson Time: Korean Alphabet, Korean Lesson Time: Korean Numbers, and Korean Lesson Time: Korean Grammar and is 16% cheaper than buying them separately.

  • Korean Lesson Time: Korean Alphabet (Retail $15)
    You can't start learning if you don't know your alphabet! The Korean alphabet consists of 40 characters, some of which are pronounced with sounds that don't exist in English. But don't worry, Korean Lesson Time will have plenty of examples of how they're supposed to sound and how to produce the sounds even if you've only grown up with English.

    This Korean Lesson Time will include an extensive PDF, audiobook form, videos describing each letter, its pronunciation and how to produce it, and its corresponding game modes in the App.

  • Korean Lesson Time: Korean Numbers (Retail $15)
    So much of life depends on being able to count: buying stuff, telling time, being with people, and expressing the order of things. Korean has two number systems, which will both be thoroughly explained in this Korean Lesson Time. 

    This Korean Lesson Time will include an extensive PDF, audiobook form, videos describing each number, its pronunciation and how to produce it, and its corresponding game modes in the App.

  • Korean Lesson Time: Korean Grammar (Retail $30)
    Instead of teaching bits and pieces of grammar over and over again in every future Topic-Based Korean Lesson Time, which would seem like a huge redundancy in what you're paying for and would take much longer to produce, We Fancy has decided to make what is basically a Korean Grammar Index.

    In this KLT, we've provided the most commonly used grammar in day-to-day life. We've explained how they should be used colloquially (natural native spoken style) so you don't sound like a walking textbook. This KLT was designed to be a reference source for your journey to Korean fluency and is meant to be read and repeated over and over again as you come across unfamiliar grammar in your life or in the Topic-Based Korean Lesson Times. With the grammar in this KLT, you should be able to navigate perfectly through your day-to-day needs. Once mastered, your Korean proficiency level will be high enough to self-learn everything else through immersion (going to Korea, hanging out with Koreans in your city, watching Korean movies and dramas with or without subtitles, etc.) or advanced studies.

Topic-Based Korean Lesson Times

The current vision for the complete Korean Lesson Time series is to have 18 more topic-based Korean Lesson Times released. These will not only be language lessons but also include etiquette, social norms, and guides where relevant. As of now, the planned topics will be:

  • Restaurants & Food
    Everything about food from what to do in a restaurant, to dishes, to ingredients, to table manners and paying bills.
  • Transportation 
    Getting from the airport to anywhere else in Korea. AREX, KTX, train, subway, bus, taxi, beyond taxis, rentals, how to ask for, understand, and give directions, etc.
  • Self-Introduction
    Name, age, physical stats, where you're from, your childhood, personality, family, education, career, dreams, hobbies, likes and dislikes, etc.
  • Making Friends
    How to make friends, social protocols, suggesting hangouts, social culture, informal speech patterns and slang, special texting language, etc.
  • Dating
    Where to meet people, how to initiate conversation, manners, behaviors, dating culture, expectations, cultural differences, etc.
  • Drinking Games
    This you'll only be able to learn by actually going to post-secondary school in Korea. A comprehensive index of Korean drinking games, the chants that go with them, and overall drinking culture.
  • Sex & More 
    Every filthy thing you want to say from Netflix and Chill to euphemisms for genitals to fetishes, all in Korean. Also, anything related to sexual health: STDs, contraceptives, body parts, bodily fluids and functions, etc. 
  • Bad Words 
    Insults, swear words, racist and sexist words... for education of course. You'd want to know when someone was using them at you, right?
  • Hotels & More
    Accommodation-types, costs, reservations, domestic traveling/holidaying/road-trips, etc.
  • Getting Your Own Place
    How to find your own place, what the different types of properties are, how to measure rooms, how to ask about amenities and what's included in the room, how to call movers and what services they provide, how to negotiate prices, how to break or cancel contracts, garbage disposal, recycling, etc.
  • Health & Hospitals
    Sicknesses, diseases, health and hospital culture, medicines, corrective surgery, glasses, dentistry, etc.
  • Plastic Surgery 
    If you're looking to fix something surgically, everything you need to know from pricing, payment, types of surgery, and what can be changed.
  • Beauty
    Cosmetics, skincare, hair styling and everything related to hair salons, fashion, nails, etc.
  • Shopping
    Spending money, negotiating prices, where to buy what, store types, payment methods, reward systems, delivery, etc.
  • Fitness 
    Working out, body parts, sports, athletics, gym memberships, negotiation memberships, diets, etc.
  • Emergencies
    Anything related to if you're suddenly in trouble, car-related, traffic related, police, fire, medical, work, etc.
  • Daily Life
    All the miscellaneous things that make up one's daily life like banking, phone plans, taxes, insurance, getting a vehicle and the right licenses, visas, dealing with difficult people, etc.
  • Celebrations
    National holidays, general holidays, break times, special celebration events, moments, and occasions, expected manners and behaviors, gift giving, gift receiving, etc.

After getting some feedback from our surveys, we may also develop proficiency-levels within those topics to create a more easily consumable structure.

Pricing will vary between the courses depending on how much information and how useful we believe they will be for you guys.

Every single one of these Topic-Based Korean Lesson Times will include PDFs, audiobook form, videos, and their corresponding App features.

Of course, these may be subject to change, but change will be positive and include more value for you guys, never less.

Ultimate Future Vision: XYZ Lesson Time & Localization

Ultimately, we intend for "Lesson Time" to be a huge education brand. Under one super powerful app, we'll be branching out to every major language. From there, we'd go into pre-secondary subjects like Mathematics, Sciences, History, etc. Beyond that, we see advanced, post-secondary topics such as Calculus, Advanced Sciences, Engineering, Philosophy, Literature, etc. 

All of this is using English as a starting point, but what if English isn't your native language? Well, ultimately, we'd localize all our material so that a user can pick their native tongue and learn everything, including English, using their native language!

One day, with your help and support, we hope to be the leading global education resource with a brand that is synonymous with practical, fun, and actually effective.

story:
Instant Find (IF)

Established on November 1, 2013

The inspiration for Instant Find came from a conversation with my son. He was talking about the frustration he feels when he goes out to a nightclub because he doesn’t know who is single and who isn't. He commented that he wished there were a way to tell who the single people were. I completely agreed with him because I also have that frustration of wondering who is single when I am out at an event. The conversation grew into various directions of how to create an app that would help singles meet one another. The excitement of being able to solve this problem spouted the creation of Instant Find.


Progress

  • MARKET AND COMPETITION ANALYSIS
  • LICENSE AND REGISTRATION SECURED 
  • HIRED DEVELOPER
  • HIRED ATTORNEY
  • PHASE 1 PATENTED 
  • WEBSITE, FACEBOOK AND TWITTER PRESENCE
  • LAUNCHED FUNCTIONING SMARTPHONE PROTOTYPE APP

Our goal is to complete the development of Instant Find and launch the application prior to the exciting times of New Years Eve and Valentine's Day.

There's more work to be done and we are looking for you to help us. We need you. You can be a part of an idea that will help  people find and connect with singles. No one wants to be alone but the truth is, it is difficult to meet single people. We can change that. You and Instant Find will be able to give Singles the tool they need to find one another.

What We Need

  • $38,800 to launch Instant Find. 
  •  Where will it go:                                                                                                       Completion of development  by Zco Corp. located in Nashua, NH.                 Phase II patenting and marketing.                                                                         Features and upgrade development. 
  • We have created perks for various levels of donation - please view the "Perks" category. 

The Impact

The dating scene has changed.  With all of the online dating websites, singles are stuck behind a screen trying to find someone they may want to meet. They spend hours reading and creating profiles that display no real personality or emotion.

We need to change that!

Instant Find allows you to input search criteria that will then display "selfies" of singles within 100 feet of you, based on the information you put in - no matter where you are... it's instant!

Instant Find brings people together for true face to face conversation, revealing true expression and emotion. 

Safety

Instant Find has built-in security features that protect our customers. We have made safety one of our core principles and we are dedicated to keeping safety a number one priority.


Help Us!!!

Make a contribution -  $25, $50, $100 - $2500 Collectively we can succeed at publicly launching the Instant Find app. You can make a difference! 

  • Spread the word - let your friends and family know that they can become part of this great opportunity by helping to launch Instant Find. Like and share our Indiegogo campaign page link. 

Thank You!

You are what will make us a reality. Instant Find looks forward to helping people  create many friendships and relationships. Thank you for supporting our mission.
story_txt:
Instant Find (IF)
 Established on November 1, 2013


The
inspiration for Instant Find came from a conversation with my son. He was
talking about the frustration he feels when he goes out to a nightclub because
he doesn’t know who is single and who isn't. He commented that he wished there
were a way to tell who the single people were. I completely agreed with him
because I also have that frustration of wondering who is single when I am out
at an event. The conversation grew into various directions of how to create an
app that would help singles meet one another. The excitement of being able to
solve this problem spouted the creation of Instant Find.
Progress

MARKET AND COMPETITION ANALYSIS
LICENSE AND REGISTRATION SECURED 
HIRED DEVELOPER
HIRED ATTORNEY
PHASE 1 PATENTED 
WEBSITE, FACEBOOK AND TWITTER PRESENCE

LAUNCHED FUNCTIONING SMARTPHONE PROTOTYPE APP

Our goal is to complete the development of Instant Find and launch the application prior to the exciting times of New Years Eve and Valentine's Day.

There's more work to be done and we are looking for you to help us. We need you. You can be a part of an idea that will help  people find and connect with singles. No one wants to be alone but the truth is, it is difficult to meet single people. We can change that. You and Instant Find will be able to give Singles the tool they need to find one another. 
  What We Need 


$38,800 to launch Instant Find. 
 Where will it go:                                                                                                       Completion of development  by Zco Corp. located in Nashua, NH.                 Phase II patenting and marketing.                                                                         Features and upgrade development. 


We have created perks for various levels of donation - please view the "Perks" category.  
  The Impact The dating scene has changed.  With all of the online dating websites, singles are stuck behind a screen trying to find someone they may want to meet. They spend hours reading and creating profiles that display no real personality or emotion.
We need to change that! 
Instant Find allows you to input search criteria that will then display "selfies" of singles within 100 feet of you, based on the information you put in - no matter where you are... it's instant! 
Instant Find brings people together for true face to face conversation, revealing true expression and emotion. 

Safety
Instant Find has built-in security features that protect our customers. We have made safety one of our core principles and we are dedicated to keeping safety a number one priority. 
  
Help Us!!!
Make a contribution -  $25, $50, $100 - $2500 Collectively we can succeed at publicly launching the Instant Find app. You can make a difference! 

Spread the word - let your friends and family know that they can become part of this great opportunity by helping to launch Instant Find. Like and share our Indiegogo campaign page link. 
 
 Thank You!You are what will make us a reality. Instant Find looks forward to helping people  create many friendships and relationships. Thank you for supporting our mission.

story:
Marketplace for mobile app developers

The Android and iOS markets are booming right now. With all the high-end mobile devices and tablets being used daily all over the world.

Since the launch of the iPhone in 2007 and the resultant boom in smart phones, mobile apps have become the hot spot for new businesses.

Before launching your business into the app world note that developing a mobile app is not cheap, whether you put the hours in yourself, or pay a pro to develop your product.

The easiest and most successful way to start is by buying a entire app with its full rigths or (a cheaper way) by buying a copy of the source code.

So, we have launched Sale My Source Code, the ultimate marketplace for mobile app developers.

We have more than 120 active users, more than 120.000 visitors weekly and 30 published apps.

We need your help to grow

We have estimated a maximum of $10,000 to start the growth phase:

  • Contracting a new hosting with more features. This is the first priority for investment funds.

  • Development of the functionality to offer trading of apps full rights.                           
  • Marketing activities to attract new users.

Other ways to help us

  • Spread the campaign and generate echo.
  • Use Indiegogo tools to share.

story:
Today, we are excited to introduce the SolidMaker, an affordable, user-friendly, laser SLA 3D printer that brings your creativity to life. SolidMaker is cost-effective, powerful, versatile, and prints better than you can imagine. It is a leading next-generation laser SLA 3D printer that delivers professional-quality prints to your desktop. 
 

If you are looking for professional printers that can deliver stunning details, stereolithography (SLA) machines are the right choice. Laser SLA 3D printing produces high-resolution results with smooth finishes that you cannot get from FDM, DLP or even LCD printers. It uses a precision UV laser to cure photosensitive resins into 3D objects with a incredible detail. 

However, laser stereolithography 3D printers have traditionally been very expensive, often costing thousands of dollars. In an effort to reduce costs and elevate performance, we took our years of industry experience and applied dedicated R&D to create a printer with advanced materials, structure, and modules. 

Now, SolidMaker can meet consumers' demands for high performance, reliability, and low-cost. By offering a highly precise laser SLA 3D printer at a breakthrough price, high-performance 3D printing is now available in the perfect cost range for artisans, designers and small businesses.
 

  •  Top-notch Printing Quality | 3 Microns Laser Movement Accuracy 
     

Unlike DLP and LCD 3D Printer, laser 3D printers' accuracy depends on the minimum movement distance of laser spot. With minimum 0.003/0.01mm XYZ laser movement accuracy, SolidMaker can eke out astonishing high-resolution 3D prints. It’s perfect for both beginners and professions being used to make razor handles, movie props and even false teeth, etc. 
 

  • Bigger Printing Area | Up to 4.7 x 4.7 x 6’’(120x120x150mm) 
     

Supporting the printing area of up to 4.7 x 4.7 x 6’’(120x120x150mm), SolidMaker is ideal for making 3D objects of medical models, architecture renditions, and other large-scale formats in a single print. With larger print sizes, SolidMaker has virtually infinite applications. 

 
  •  Excellent Laser Speed | 320mm/s, Twice the Efficiency 
     

3D printing technology has been in the industry for decades, however, speed has been a limiting factor – until today. SolidMaker can print faster than typical SLA 3d printers without sacrificing surface finish quality and detail accuracy. Your stunning high-resolution creations take shape in minutes.  
 

  • Laser Stereolithography | 100 µm Spot Size for Finest Details
     

Unlike some of the SLA printers on the market, SolidMaker is driven by a UV laser. With its 100 µm spot, SolidMaker can print with precision and speed. It scans the laser into the vat and solidifies resin into objects, and after a layer is finished, it raises the build platform slightly and cures the next layer.
 

  • Compatible with 3rd Party Resins | Print without Limitation
     

Many 3D printers available today only officially support their own company-produced resins. This is inconvenient and can put expensive limitations on consumers. SolidMaker is different. It works with most available resins, such as standard resins, dental resins, flexible resins, engineering resins, and more.

 
  •  Five Resins Available | White/Blue/Grey/Red/Yellow 
     

SolidMaker 405nm resin is specially designed for reducing volume shrinkage and printing time during the building process, as well as ensuring a highly-precise print model. SolidMaker comes with five colors of standard resins, allowing you to print 3D objects in virtually any color you want.
 

  • 3.5″ Intuitive Touchscreen | User-Friendly Design
     

SolidMaker Pro has simple, intuitive controls by way of a 3.5″ touchscreen interface that supports multiple languages, selecting print files, layer thicknesses, and other essential parameters. This user-friendly control process makes 3D printing simple, fast and convenient for both beginners and professionals alike.  

 
  • Real-time Calibration | 99.5% Print Success Rate
     

Real-time calibration ensures a near-perfect success rate for prints. Instead of constant adjustments that are typical with other printers, we installed the calibration system inside the machine, where it monitors itself continuously to maintain perfect laser placement and model accuracy. 

 
  •  Plug-and-Play | One-press to Print 
     

A good 3D printer should be designed for everyone. That’s why SolidMaker is intuitive and easy to use. With a one-press print process and easy to understand controls, children and adults alike can easily start their 3D printing journey with SolidMaker! （The USB slot will be placed in the front when mass production started.）
 

 
  • All-Metal Body
     

The all-metal body of SolidMaker is tough and durable but also elegant as a piece of art in your workshop, lab or home. It has been rigorously tested for years of reliable service and precision accuracy. 

 
  • Power-off Memory Function
     

If the power is turned off unexpectedly during printing, it can follow the previous progress when the power is turned on. No more time and consumables will be wasted due to unexpected power outages.

 
  • Slicer Software-SolidPreform
     

SolidMaker has a fully developed and easy to use a software called SolidPreform. It has an intuitive user interface that makes 3D printing easy for anyone and uses a thorough system of tests to avoid printing errors before they occur.

Video Reference:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HvdzwCWXwQQ

 

Worry-free shopping: Free Shipping + 7-Day Return Policy + 12-Month Warranty

 

 

 

GMK NucBox is an ultra-small high-performance mini PC that's designed for on-the-go productivity and 4K entertainment. Adopting the powerful Intel® 4-core processor and world’s smallest design, we believe that it will be the best replacement for your clunky traditional PC.
 


       TechRadar review           |         Liliputing  review    | 

  pc.watch review    |      today.it review       |        chinahandys.net review  

 




 

Ultra-Compact, Lightweight & Portable

GMK NucBox owns the evolutionary world’s smallest and lighweight body. We’ve shaved every unneeded millimeter to create an industry-leading level compact chassic that's only 2.4x2.4 inch, which is small enough to fit into any pocket or handbag  to carry around anywhere. Engineered with textured metal CNC process, it looks extremely sturdy and more luxurious.


 

High-End & Newest Intel® 4-Core Processor

Featured a high-performance Intel® Celeron® J4125 CPU which has 4-core 4-thread up to 2.7GHz frequency and the latest Intel® UHD Graphics 600, it will definitely bring your computing ability to the next level. The powerful performance allows you to freely enjoy unparalleled fluency and unbelievable quick response speed on GMK NucBox.



Through our a series of intense testing, the GMK NucBox can run most of mainstream lightweight games smoothly at a very high frame rate.

Advanced 4K UHD Video Playback

Backed up by the cutting-edge Intel Graphic, GMK NucBox works greatly for some complex graphics processing or graphics-hungry software. With up to 4K@60Hz playback capabilities and support H.264, H.265/HEVC, VP-9 video encoding and decoding, it brings you the most fantastic entertainment experience like movies and TV shows.


 

8GB + 512GB SSD High-Speed Storage

Its 8GB LPDDR4 high-bandwith memory offers seamless multitasking and lag-free switching between lots of resource hungry software. While 128GB/256GB/512GB SSD high-speed storage options enables to boot up your computer and launch apps in blazing fast times.

Multitude of Useful I/O Interfaces

Designed with multiple input/output connection interfaces including 2 USB-A, 1  USB-C and 1 HDMI, this super-compact GMK NucBox will furnish you with all kinds of interfaces for different types of peripherals – without being confined to the space inside the enclosure.


 

867 Mb/s Intel® 2x2 Wireless-AC

Thanks to Intel Wi-Fi card, the GMK NucBox provides you super-fast and stable wireless internet connection anywhere, anytime. With 2.4GHz/5GHz dual-band 2x2 AC Wi-Fi, it can reach up to 867 Mb/s wireless transfer speed, which is 2 time faster than some devices using 1x1 AC (only 433Mb/s).

And, the built-in Bluetooth lets you pair GMK NucBox with all kinds of Bluetooth-enabled peripherals, such as: mouse, keyboard, speaker and so on.


 

Whisper Quiet Thermal Engineering

In addition to adopting the just 10W low power consumption design, our engineers also create a customized 90mm cooling fan to keep the crucial components’s temperature down. Besides that, it will be astonishingly quiet, noise is controlled within just 19db based the lab testing. Just enjoy peak performance in a more quiet environment!


 

Supports Multiple Systems




 



 



If you like the GMK NucBox, please help us spread the word about it by sharing the campaign with your friends and family!



 







 

Meet the GMK 4K Portable Monitor

In order to bring you the most perfect on-the-go productivity and entertainment experience, we've provided our latest 4K(3840*2160) portable monitor together with GMK NucBox. Packed an advanced 14 inch 4K super high-resolution display, it is not only a good partner for  NucBox, but also suitable for laptop, smartphone, PS4, and so on.  For more information, pls refer to our website.

(Note: the 4K monitor perks offered on Indiegogo comes without PD charger )

 

 

 



 

GMK was founded in June 2019, all of the core team members have rich industry experience and a strong R&D and production background and pretty firm solid connection with the supply chain in digital consumer eletronics. It was their vast shared experience, nearly 20 years from their former career, that brought them together.

And in a year's time, GMK mini PC - the NucBox, was created in a new form, a new level. The initial purpose of this product is to offer ultimate ease of use with its ultra-small form factor and lightweight design. 

 



 



With extensive industry experience and our powerful supply chain, we are very confident that we can minimize almost all the risks and challenges about this project, to all the backers. At present, we have finished the T2 prototype of GMK NucBox, and we have already finalized a successful round of pre-production, the hardware is already fully verified in production.

The reason we are crowdfunding here is to allow us to raise the huge funds for research & development and making sure we can get the best price for the best components on the market. We promise that all the funds we raised here will be used for GMK NucBox project. With your great support and our continuous efforts, we believe that we will be able to deliver GMK NucBox to all backers on time.

Engineered with textured metal CNC process, it looks extremely sturdy and more luxurious. High-End & Newest Intel® 4-Core ProcessorFeatured a high-performance Intel® Celeron® J4125 CPU which has 4-core 4-thread up to 2.7GHz frequency and the latest Intel® UHD Graphics 600, it will definitely bring your computing ability to the next level. The powerful performance allows you to freely enjoy unparalleled fluency and unbelievable quick response speed on GMK NucBox.Through our a series of intense testing, the GMK NucBox can run most of mainstream lightweight games smoothly at a very high frame rate.Advanced 4K UHD Video PlaybackBacked up by the cutting-edge Intel Graphic, GMK NucBox works greatly for some complex graphics processing or graphics-hungry software. With up to 4K@60Hz playback capabilities and support H.264, H.265/HEVC, VP-9 video encoding and decoding, it brings you the most fantastic entertainment experience like movies and TV shows. 8GB + 512GB SSD High-Speed StorageIts 8GB LPDDR4 high-bandwith memory offers seamless multitasking and lag-free switching between lots of resource hungry software. While 128GB/256GB/512GB SSD high-speed storage options enables to boot up your computer and launch apps in blazing fast times.Multitude of Useful I/O InterfacesDesigned with multiple input/output connection interfaces including 2 USB-A, 1  USB-C and 1 HDMI, this super-compact GMK NucBox will furnish you with all kinds of interfaces for different types of peripherals – without being confined to the space inside the enclosure. 867 Mb/s Intel® 2x2 Wireless-ACThanks to Intel Wi-Fi card, the GMK NucBox provides you super-fast and stable wireless internet connection anywhere, anytime. With 2.4GHz/5GHz dual-band 2x2 AC Wi-Fi, it can reach up to 867 Mb/s wireless transfer speed, which is 2 time faster than some devices using 1x1 AC (only 433Mb/s).And, the built-in Bluetooth lets you pair GMK NucBox with all kinds of Bluetooth-enabled peripherals, such as: mouse, keyboard, speaker and so on. Whisper Quiet Thermal EngineeringIn addition to adopting the just 10W low power consumption design, our engineers also create a customized 90mm cooling fan to keep the crucial components’s temperature down. Besides that, it will be astonishingly quiet, noise is controlled within just 19db based the lab testing. Just enjoy peak performance in a more quiet environment! Supports Multiple Systems  If you like the GMK NucBox, please help us spread the word about it by sharing the campaign with your friends and family!  Meet the GMK 4K Portable MonitorIn order to bring you the most perfect on-the-go productivity and entertainment experience, we've provided our latest 4K(3840*2160) portable monitor together with GMK NucBox. Packed an advanced 14 inch 4K super high-resolution display, it is not only a good partner for  NucBox, but also suitable for laptop, smartphone, PS4, and so on.  For more information, pls refer to our website.(Note: the 4K monitor perks offered on Indiegogo comes without PD charger )


 

 
  GMK was founded in June 2019, all of the core team members have rich industry experience and a strong R&D and production background and pretty firm solid connection with the supply chain in digital consumer eletronics. It was their vast shared experience, nearly 20 years from their former career, that brought them together.And in a year's time, GMK mini PC - the NucBox, was created in a new form, a new level. The initial purpose of this product is to offer ultimate ease of use with its ultra-small form factor and lightweight design.   With extensive industry experience and our powerful supply chain, we are very confident that we can minimize almost all the risks and challenges about this project, to all the backers. At present, we have finished the T2 prototype of GMK NucBox, and we have already finalized a successful round of pre-production, the hardware is already fully verified in production.The reason we are crowdfunding here is to allow us to raise the huge funds for research & development and making sure we can get the best price for the best components on the market. We promise that all the funds we raised here will be used for GMK NucBox project. With your great support and our continuous efforts, we believe that we will be able to deliver GMK NucBox to all backers on time.

story:
SMILE Blankets

Our Story


Our names are John & Kara Huntinghouse and Demetrius and Audrey Matuauto.  We're the co-founders of the SMILE blankets.  The idea for this campaign started when our (John and Kara) one day old baby was admitted to Primary Children’s Hospital and diagnosed with Hirschsprung’s Disease.  After spending over a week in the hospital we were greatly impacted by the donations we received during our stay.  We have always wanted to help other families who are going through similar situations.

As we were talking with our friends Demetrius and Audrey, we found out that they were in the process of making and donating blankets to the children’s hospital in our city.  We loved this idea and created the SMILE blankets.  

When a child is in the hospital, all the small things add up.  When they are sick and spend all of their time in the same place day after day, little things start becoming miracles.  SMILE is an acronym for “Small miracles in life everyday.”  Please help us remind these children to look for the small miracles in their lives everyday.  

How the Process Works

It’s easy!  When you buy a SMILE blanket, we will donate a SMILE blanket to a sick child in a hospital. When you buy two SMILE blankets, we will donate two SMILE blankets to two children.  

When that child has their blanket with the SMILE logo, not only will they be comforted but they will be reminded to look for the small, everyday miracles that happen in their lives.

Along with receiving your blanket in the mail you will be notified which hospital your blanket was donated to. When blanket orders are processed you will be able to visit our Facebook page to see the updated photographs and places to which we are donating.


The Blankets

Specifications

Sherpa plush fleece blanket

Size: 45 x 60 inches

Eco-friendly


Blanket Colors

Each blanket will have the SMILE acronym embroidered in the corner of the blanket






FAQ:


Q: When do I choose the color of my blanket?
A:  Once the campaign has been fully funded, we will be contacting the contributors for their color choice directly.

Q:  Do you have additional colors?
A:  We will update the campaign with any additional colors that come available.


Q:  When should I expect the blankets to arrive?
A:  We expect that it will take around 2 months from when the campaign ends to receive your blanket.


Q:  Does this include shipping?
A:  Yes, for any order placed in the continental US, shipping is included in the cost.  For international shipments, please add $25 to your contribution for shipping.


Another way you can help is to share this campaign with your friends and family through social media.  Every little bit helps. 


Picture Gallery

story:
Project Summary

Hi, my name is Alex Epshteyn, and I’m the developer behind TypeRacer, the world’s first multiplayer typing game, which I built using GWT.  For the latest release of TypeRacer, I finally solved the biggest problem I’ve always had with GWT: its lack of debugging information for client-side exceptions in production.

I spent the past three months patching the GWT compiler and libraries to generate perfect Java-like stack traces whenever JavaScript exceptions arise in my deployed GWT app.  As a result of my new ability to see the exact Java line numbers and Java activation stack of any JavaScript exception on my website, I’m able to track down bugs which would otherwise have been impossible to find!

My deployed GWT application now records logs that look like this:

com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptException: (TypeError) : a is null com.google.gwt.dom.client.DOMImplMozilla.$getBodyOffsetLeft(DOMImplMozilla.java:145) com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.PopupPanel.$setPopupPosition(Document.java:1287) com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.PopupPanel.setPopupPosition(PopupPanel.java:884) com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.PopupPanel.PopupPanel(PopupPanel.java:453) com.typeracer.commons.client.widgets.EnhancedPopup.EnhancedPopup(EnhancedPopup.java:32) com.typeracer.commons.client.widgets.PopupWithIcon.PopupWithIcon(PopupWithFocusableTextBox.java:28) com.typeracer.main.client.controller.TyperacerUncaughtExceptionHandler$1.execute (TyperacerUncaughtExceptionHandler.java:55) com.google.gwt.core.client.impl.SchedulerImpl.runScheduledTasks(SchedulerImpl.java:50) etc... :-)

instead of:

lineNumber: 3190 columnNumber: 15354: a is null; (TypeError) fileName: http://localhost:8088/9C4DC2D905BEA407601C92C56B43E3B8.cache.html stack: @http://localhost:8088/9C4DC2D905BEA407601C92C56B43E3B8.cache.html:2422 Rub@http://localhost:8088/9C4DC2D905BEA407601C92C56B43E3B8.cache.html:2423 dSb@http://localhost:8088/9C4DC2D905BEA407601C92C56B43E3B8.cache.html:3190 tA@http://localhost:8088/9C4DC2D905BEA407601C92C56B43E3B8.cache.html:2810 Xmb@http://localhost:8088/9C4DC2D905BEA407601C92C56B43E3B8.cache.html:2289 etc... :-(

I wrote this research paper describing how my solution works in detail.

I’m asking the GWT community to pitch in and hire me to finish this undertaking and contribute my patch back to GWT, because I’m convinced that every GWT developer would benefit from my work.

What I Need and What You Get 

As an indie developer on a tight budget, I have to focus on money-making efforts, and I’d like to be sure that the GWT community really wants this project before I spend much more time on it.  That’s why I’m trying to raise a modest sum to sponsor my to continued efforts.  Your donation will provide the motivation I need to work on contributing my code back to the GWT project and maintaining it thereafter.  I think it might take somewhere between 40 and 100 more hours of my time to polish it, go through the code reviews, handle any issues I might not have considered, write docs and unit tests, and continue maintenance of the code after it’s been accepted into GWT.  If funded, I will do my best to see that my code makes it into the next release of GWT 2.x and GWT 3.0.

But you don’t actually have to wait until my code makes it into GWT, because everyone who contributes $25 or more, will immediately receive a JAR file that you can start using right away with GWT 2.5.0, and get perfect stack traces in your production builds!

All you have to do is make your contribution, download the JAR file that I’ll email, add it to your GWT compiler classpath, and insert this line into your .gwt.xml config:

<inherits name="com.google.gwt.core.PreserveStackTraces"/>

Your production builds will then have perfect Java-like stack traces whenever one of your users encounters an exception with any version of IE, Firefox, Safari, Opera, Chrome or any other browser supported by GWT.  Best of all, your code permutations deployed to Chrome users will not get any bigger, and your other code permutations will be only about 45% larger, without any significant runtime overhead (I’ve performed extensive benchmarking and testing in most browsers).  By contributing just $25, you can start using the patch right away and provide feedback on the functionality before it’s finalized.

If you are able to give more, then you may want contribute at higher levels, which include personalized email, phone, and even on-site support from me, so you can benefit from my GWT experience.  You can also your support perk to ask for advice on other matters or even ask me to build other GWT compiler tweaks specific to your needs.

But you don’t have to give a lot to shape the future of this project.  Even the smallest contribution is a vote for me to keep going.

The Impact

If you develop applications using GWT, you will see the impact of this project as soon as you deploy your app and get perfect stack traces with exact Java source line numbers from any JavaScript exception thrown in any user’s browser.  It will save you hours, days, and weeks spent blindly searching for bugs, both in your code as well as in GWT code.

I believe the impact of this crowdfunding campaign could also be much broader than that.  If this project reaches its funding goal, it might encourage more developers to work on other major improvements to GWT.  Now that GWT is spinning off into an independent OSS project and Google appears to have significantly reduced its resources allocated to GWT, perhaps crowdfunding campaigns could become a way to sustain GWT as the best alternative to JavaScript for developing web and mobile applications for years to come.

My Story 

I started using GWT 7 years ago, shortly after I finished my Computer Science master’s degree at UMass Amherst.  In grad school I was particularly interested in compilers, Java runtimes, and bytecode instrumentation, which is probably why I decided to tackle this crazy-difficult GWT compiler project that you’re reading about now.  But back in 2006, with my grad school obligations just finished, I wanted to finally do something a little less serious.  That’s when I embarked on a quest to make the world's first multiplayer typing game.  At the same time I discovered GWT, which allowed me to use my Java skills to build a rich-client MMO game that anyone could play through a web browser.  That’s how TypeRacer, my bootstrapped startup venture, was born.  Launched in 2008, typeracer.com quickly grew to over a hundred thousand monthly users.

After receiving email from users describing various cryptic bugs, I set up a system to log all JavaScript exceptions in production to Google Analytics.  I let the data accumulate for a couple days and when I looked at all the exceptions that showed up on my Google Analytics screen, I was really surprised.  There were dozens of different types of client-side exceptions being reported that I had never seen during development and I had no idea how to reproduce any of them, because I didn’t know where in my source code these exceptions originated.  For the next release I worked on adding stack traces to those exception reports, and I quickly realized that JavaScript stack traces weren’t available in all browsers, and even if they were available, they were useless, since my code was deployed obfuscated.  Deploying “pretty” code was out of the question, because it would increase the download time, decrease performance, and reveal the “secret sauce” of the app.  All of these things are important when competitors are trying to clone your app and enter your market.  Also, the most popular browser of the day (the same one one that had the most bugs) did not provide stack traces either way.

After all these cryptic exceptions had become enough of a nuisance, I started a little research project to see if I could develop a precompiler which could modify Java code to maintain an artificial call stack.  This, along with a few auxiliary classes, enabled me to get Java stack traces with method-level granularity in all browsers, and I passed out a white paper describing this project at Google I/O 2009.  The precompiler I wrote in 2009 is the predecessor of this project and I’ve been using it in my production builds up until now.  Unfortunately that solution wasn’t perfect, since it only showed the methods on the stack and not complete activation records with line numbers, nor did it cover native methods.  It did help track down some of the bugs that were causing the exceptions, but many still remained elusive.  Despite the shortcomings, I decided my precompiler was good enough for the time being (in the cost vs. benefit sense) and stopped working on it.  However, three months ago, while upgrading my app from GWT 1.5 to 2.5, I got the itch to finally solve this ridiculously hard problem once and for all.

The reason for my renewed interest in this problem was my discovery of some new experimental features in GWT, which are described on the WebModeExceptions wiki page and this excellent article.  I was really excited to try these experimental settings, but my excitement turned into disappointment when I discovered that none of them actually work correctly.  But, I could see that the foundation for a working solution had been laid, and I thought I’d be able to re-implement the code more correctly and more efficiently.  With a little time and effort, I was sure I could finally solve the problem of JavaScript stack traces in production that I’ve been having since 2008.

That’s why three months ago I dived into the GWT compiler source code and did not come up for air until about 10 weeks later, after I had fixed every bug in the existing solution, made the stack traces more Java-like, reduced the compiled code size overhead by nearly 50%, and made the configuration user-friendly and able to take advantage of the source map support in Chrome.  You can read about the technical details in my writeup.

In the 10 weeks I spent hacking the GWT compiler to carry out this project, I’ve learned almost as much about JavaScript and GWT as I had in the last 7 years as a user of both, and it was one of the most interesting projects I’ve ever done.  But it was also frustrating, because in the beginning, I could only see the tip of the iceberg in terms of how broken things were with the original implementation, so I couldn’t have predicted that it would take nearly my entire spring season to finish.  For a while it seemed that every problem I solved exposed new problems that were previously hidden, and there were dozens of these.   If you’re curious, you can read more about those challenges, as well as the complete implementation details, in my research writeup.  Some of the problems were really interesting to work on and led to some really cool discoveries and solutions, while other problems, like browser-specific bugs in JavaScript interpreters, were mostly just frustrating.  Nevertheless, I was hooked, and I kept going until I got everything to work perfectly.

The upside of my efforts is a patch for GWT 2.5 that I’m already using for TypeRacer’s production builds to get perfect Java-like stack traces in all browsers.  The downside is that during those extra 3 months of heads-down work on this problem, TypeRacer stagnated and I turned down offers to do paid consulting work for my previous clients.  At the same time, I realized that, if at all possible, I’d rather be doing paid consulting work for the GWT project itself.  That’s why I decided to try this crowdfunding campaign to fund the final stage of the project: integrating my code into GWT.

Thank you for reading!

The reason for my renewed interest in this problem was my discovery of some new experimental features in GWT, which are described on the WebModeExceptions wiki page and this excellent article.  I was really excited to try these experimental settings, but my excitement turned into disappointment when I discovered that none of them actually work correctly.  But, I could see that the foundation for a working solution had been laid, and I thought I’d be able to re-implement the code more correctly and more efficiently.  With a little time and effort, I was sure I could finally solve the problem of JavaScript stack traces in production that I’ve been having since 2008.
That’s why three months ago I dived into the GWT compiler source code and did not come up for air until about 10 weeks later, after I had fixed every bug in the existing solution, made the stack traces more Java-like, reduced the compiled code size overhead by nearly 50%, and made the configuration user-friendly and able to take advantage of the source map support in Chrome.  You can read about the technical details in my writeup.
In the 10 weeks I spent hacking the GWT compiler to carry out this project, I’ve learned almost as much about JavaScript and GWT as I had in the last 7 years as a user of both, and it was one of the most interesting projects I’ve ever done.  But it was also frustrating, because in the beginning, I could only see the tip of the iceberg in terms of how broken things were with the original implementation, so I couldn’t have predicted that it would take nearly my entire spring season to finish.  For a while it seemed that every problem I solved exposed new problems that were previously hidden, and there were dozens of these.   If you’re curious, you can read more about those challenges, as well as the complete implementation details, in my research writeup.  Some of the problems were really interesting to work on and led to some really cool discoveries and solutions, while other problems, like browser-specific bugs in JavaScript interpreters, were mostly just frustrating.  Nevertheless, I was hooked, and I kept going until I got everything to work perfectly.
The upside of my efforts is a patch for GWT 2.5 that I’m already using for TypeRacer’s production builds to get perfect Java-like stack traces in all browsers.  The downside is that during those extra 3 months of heads-down work on this problem, TypeRacer stagnated and I turned down offers to do paid consulting work for my previous clients.  At the same time, I realized that, if at all possible, I’d rather be doing paid consulting work for the GWT project itself.  That’s why I decided to try this crowdfunding campaign to fund the final stage of the project: integrating my code into GWT.
Thank you for reading!

story:
5 Reasons for Consumers to Contribute

  1. Protect themselves, family, and the public from dangerous products.

  2. De-fund illegal operations such as sweatshops and terrorist groups. 

  3. Earn rewards such as free products and discount coupons.

  4. Receive special deals for their favorite brands.

  5. Gain inside knowledge about and learn to identify counterfeit products.

Counterfeit consumables such as pharmaceuticals and baby formulas can pose serious health risks.


5 Reasons for Brand Owners to Contribute

  1. Recapture lost sales.

  2. Protect the reputation of their products.

  3. Use social media and crowd-sourcing to monitor their brands anytime, anywhere.

  4. Build brand loyalty.

  5. Gain insights into consumer perception of their products.

Companies spend a fortune developing their products - get the best protection for those investments.


Counterfringe App Development Campaign

What It Is

Counterfringe is an online brand protection service that helps businesses and consumers exchange information about counterfeit products.  Our mobile apps will allow business participants to instantly warn a dedicated online community of consumers about counterfeit products, including those that may be dangerous to the public.  Consumers who report counterfeit products can earn rewards from their favorite brands and influence future product development.  To learn more, please visit www.counterfringe.com.


Who and Why We Are

Counterfringe was founded in 2012 by Andrew Tichovolsky, a Massachusetts attorney specializing in Intellectual Property.  Mr. Tichovolsky received his J.D. from the University of New Hampshire School of Law in 2012 and his B.A. from Cornell University in 2003.  Unlike other industries, legal services have been slow to embrace the many benefits of social networking and crowd-sourcing.  Counterfringe hopes to be a pioneer in this regard, thereby reducing costs for businesses and consumers, protecting the public from dangerous products, and eliminating a funding source for terrorist organizations.  We are not affiliated with any law firm and are devoting 100% of our time to this project.


Funding Needs

We need additional funding to finish developing our website and mobile apps and to promote our launch.  We hope to raise at least $75,000 and finish initial testing of our applications by January 2014. 


Perks

  • For Consumers

    We are guaranteeing early membership, including beta testing.  This will allow you to become a leader in the Counterfringe community, gaining early access to reward offers from our brand participants and influencing how our services develop.

  • For Brand Participants

    We are offering discounted rates on our services once we officially launch and the chance to tailor our applications to your needs.

Additional Support

Even if you cannot contribute financially, we would appreciate any help you can provide.  Please use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word about our campaign.  If you are in the brand protection industry and have any suggestions, please share them through our website www.counterfringe.com.


Thanks!

The Counterfringe Team

story:
PRE-ORDER NOW and SAVE or DONATE to the DREAM

               This has been a long time dream of ours and now we're nearly ready for launch - all we need is your help!

               Our Super Cool Key heads and Fun Clips are made from high quality, durable plastic that will last for years. Each product is handmade. The machines used to dry, craft and cut the keys are built from scratch by us. 

               Each product is coated with a high gloss/scratch resistant finish for that extra appeal and protection. Every Key and Fun Clip is guaranteed to have the highest quality in detail.

              Can be produced into all types of keys - House keys, Car keys, Bike keys, Shed keys, Pad keys. Anything that requires a key, we can turn into a Super Cool Key or Fun Clip.

 

Category Selections:

Custom Keys Process:

               Send us a photo of anything you want to be made into a Super Cool Key or Fun Clip : Face shots, Cars, Sports teams, Video Game Characters, Pets, Artwork or whatever your imagination can think of. Our certified graphics team will edit the image down and turn it into a one of a kind Super Cool Key. Our creations will make an amazing gift for every special occasion - including birthdays, anniversary and holidays.


 

Super Cool Fun Clip:

Why buy from us?

               We have a wide variety of selections. Our entire catalog will be available to you for only $7 (Will retail for $10 after campaign ends), and for a limited time receive 20% off a customizable key of your choice. Just send us your favorite video game character, sports team, or a photo of your friend's pet so we can make them a one of a kind gift! 

               Our keys are vibrant, unique, colorful - just like you. Each one is a representation of your  awesome personality.

 

 

 

               There are several different ways to determine the type of key you require for your lock. It's highly recommended that you use all 3 methods as in unique cases your key shape may differ. If none of the following methods work you can head to your nearest WalMart/Lowes/Home Depot for a professional opinion.

METHOD ONE - Shape of your key head

               Generally you can figure out which key type you have by looking at the head of your key. KWIKSET keys have a more rounded shape with 3 or 1 holes at the top whereas SCHLAGE keys are closer to a diamond shape with only one key ring role and a rougher edge.

METHOD TWO - Key Trench 1 vs 2

Real simple - If your key has TWO trenches, you probably have the KWIKSET Key. 

                          If your key has ONE trench then its likely you have the SCHLAGE Key.

METHOD THREE - Key Engraving 

               This method is the best sure fire way to tell which key type you require - although not all keys have engravings. If your key does, it'll make things that much easier.

If your key reads: KW1, KW10, 66, 6, 65 or 5 - You have a KWIKSET Key.

If your key reads: SC1, 68 or C - You have the SCHLAGE Key.

FAQs

Where does the product Ship from?

We are based in Vancover, BC Canada - Our products will ship from here

How do I select which design I want?

Once the campaign ends you'll receive a survey to select your Key/Clip choice.

How will you cut my Key to fit my lock?

We'll help you figure out which key type you need and create your design on a key blank - You will have to get it cut yourself at a local Wal-Mart/Home Depot/Home Hardware.

Can I chose the outline color for my custom Key/Clip?

Yes! When sending us us your photo, you can make a special request; Color, shape, cutout ect.

Which Keys will be available for pre designed selection?

Everything you see on our Indiegogo will be available as a pre designed Key. More designs will become available as our campaign grows. You'll have a selection of 100 choices by the end of the campaign.

What If I have a different Key type?

As long as you know your Key type we'll order it for you and turn it into a Super Cool Key!

ALL SHIPPING WITHIN CANADA IS FREE

(Indiegogo Exclusive)
